ruditas: <entryFree id="n41959" type="hapax" key="ru^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. rudis</etym>, <sense id="n41959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteratoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, p. 363, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruditus: <entryFree id="n41960" type="hapax" key="ru^di_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rudo</etym>, <sense id="n41960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roaring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">braying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudo: <entryFree id="n41961" type="main" key="ru^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdo</orth> (rūdo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 9</bibl>), īvi, ītum (<sense id="n41961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> rudentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 16</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. root ru-, to howl; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)ru/w</foreign>; cf. Lat.: ravis, ravus, raucus], <hi rend="ital">to roar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bray.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41961.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. of lions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of stags,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 374</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of bears,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 298</bibl></cit>; esp. freq. of the <hi rend="ital">braying</hi> of an ass, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:433" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 433</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 342</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41961.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of men, <hi rend="ital">to roar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>: haec inquam rudet ex rostris, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cacum) insueta rudentem Alcides telis premit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 248</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: rudentem proram,</quote> <trans><tr>creaking</tr>, <tr>groaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 561</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rudor: <entryFree id="n41962" type="main" key="ru^dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rudo</etym>, <sense id="n41962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roaring</hi> (Appul.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 357, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mund. p. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rudus: <entryFree id="n41963" type="main" key="ru_dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n41963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stones broken small and mingled with lime</hi> for plastering walls, paving floors, etc. </sense><sense id="n41963.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudus inicere solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 2</bibl> Mai: aedificia tecta rudere aut pavimentis, Auct. B. Alex. 1, 3: rudere, non tegulis teguntur, Auct. B. Hisp. 8, 2: pingue, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rich soil</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 81.— </sense><sense id="n41963.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">old rubbish</hi>, of the stones, plaster, etc., of decayed buildings (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ruderi accipiendo Ostienses paludes destinabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum Tiberis laxavit ac repurgavit, completum olim ruderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41964" type="main" key="ru_dus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūdus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, v. raudus.</entryFree>
rudusculum: <entryFree id="n41965" type="main" key="ru_duscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūduscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. raudusculum.</entryFree>
rufesco: <entryFree id="n41966" type="main" key="ru_fesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūfesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n41966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [rufus], <hi rend="ital">to become reddish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 42, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:194" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 53, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:143" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 19, 36, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rufius: <entryFree id="n41967" type="foreign" key="rufius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rufius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gallic name for</hi> chama, <hi rend="ital">a lynx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 19, 28, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rufo: <entryFree id="n41968" type="main" key="ru_fo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūfo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rufus</etym>, <sense id="n41968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">color reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:67" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 2, 32, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:91" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 46, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rufrae: <entryFree id="n41969" type="main" key="Ru^frae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭfrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Samnites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ruvo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 739</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:568" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 568</bibl>; prob. the same called <hi rend="ital">Rufrium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rufrium: <entryFree id="n41970" type="main" key="Ru^fri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭfrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Rufrae.</entryFree>
rufulus: <entryFree id="n41971" type="main" key="ru_fu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūfŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n41971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rufus], <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather red.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41971.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">macilentis malis rufulus,</quote> <trans><tr>red-haired</tr>, <tr>red-headed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit> (cf. rufus): <cit><quote lang="la">radices mandragorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41971.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūfŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the military tribunes chosen by the general himself</hi> (opp. to the Comitiati, who were chosen by the people in the Comitia); <cit><quote lang="la">so called after one Rutilius Rufus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=261" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 261</bibl> Müll.; Ps.-Ascon. ap. Div. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:10, p. 142" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 10, p. 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rufus: <entryFree id="n41972" type="main" key="ru_fus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūfus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with ruber</etym>, <sense id="n41972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, of all shades, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 5</bibl>.—In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rufus quidam,</quote> <trans><tr>redhaired</tr>, <tr>red-headed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 1</bibl> (cf. rufulus): <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:129:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 129, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campana siligo rufior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41973" type="main" key="Ru_fus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūfus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. rufus</etym>, <sense id="n41973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a common Roman surname</hi> (like the German Roth, Rother), Quint, 1, 4, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19</bibl> tit.; 14, 14, 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
ruga: <entryFree id="n41974" type="main" key="ru_ga1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crease in the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wrinkle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41974.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; usu. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n41974.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cani non rugae repente auctoritatem arripere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos populumque Romanum non consilio neque eloquentiā, sed rugis supercilioque decepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: nec pietas moram Rugis et instanti senectae Afferet, <pb n="1604" /> <cb n="RUIN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis tu remittere aliquid ex rugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugas in fronte contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugis vetus Frontem senectus exaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: frontem rugis arat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 417</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tarda senectus inducat rugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcare cutem rugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 276</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 232</bibl> et saep. al.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: de rugis crimina multa cadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41974.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">faceret scissas languida ruga genas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit> (3, 10), 6; 3 (4), 25, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 34</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:325" default="NO">14, 325</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41974.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrugation</hi>, etc., of any kind (post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rugo, I.): margaritae flavescunt senectā rugisque torpescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilonis afflatus poma deturpans rugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 7, 14, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:107 al" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 14, 24, § 107 al.</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">folds</hi> of garments, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam deciens redit in rugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:79" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 79</bibl></cit> Gildersleeve ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes quoque diutius vinctas ruga consumet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41974.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The female screw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 317</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41975" type="main" key="Ru_ga2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. ruga</etym>, <sense id="n41975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. of Sp. Carvilius, whose divorce is said to have been the first in Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:44" default="NO">17, 21, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rugatio: <entryFree id="n41976" type="main" key="ru_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rugo</etym>, <sense id="n41976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrinkling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rugii: <entryFree id="n41977" type="main" key="Rugi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rugĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people</hi> who have given their name to the island of <hi rend="ital">Rügen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ruginosus: <entryFree id="n41978" type="hapax" key="ru_gi_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūgīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. ruga</etym>, <sense id="n41978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rugio: <entryFree id="n41979" type="main" key="ru^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n41979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roar</hi>, as a lion, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 21, 13</bibl>; Auct. Carm. Philom. 49; <hi rend="ital">to bray</hi>, as an ass, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">onager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ursi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:59:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 59, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41979.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rumble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugientem saturare ventrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n41979.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call aloud</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 37, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 25, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rugitus: <entryFree id="n41980" type="main" key="ru^gi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭgītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rugio</etym>. <sense id="n41980.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A roaring</hi> of lions, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41980.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rumbling</hi> in the bowels, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:7" default="NO">4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rugo: <entryFree id="n41981" type="main" key="ru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n41981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. ruga]. </sense><sense id="n41981.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkle;</hi> transf., of the dress (cf. 1. ruga, B.), <hi rend="ital">to become wrinkled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rumpled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide palliolum ut rugat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: pallium, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n41981.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wrinkle</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to corrugate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testae (concharum) rugatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rugositas: <entryFree id="n41982" type="main" key="ru_go_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūgōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rugosus</etym>, <sense id="n41982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being wrinkled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugosity</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">moeroris aut irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rugosus: <entryFree id="n41983" type="main" key="ru_go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūgōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. ruga</etym>, <sense id="n41983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled.</hi> </sense><sense id="n41983.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rugosiorem cum geras stola frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spadones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 112</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore pagus (i. e. the villagers),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanna,</quote> <trans><tr>that wrinkles his countenance</tr>, <tr>makes wry faces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:91" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41983.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to 1. ruga, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">wrinkled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrugated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:28:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruidus: <entryFree id="n41984" type="hapax" key="ru^i^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, perh. <sense id="n41984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum (in pisturā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruina: <entryFree id="n41985" type="main" key="ru^i_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ruo</etym>, <sense id="n41985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumbling down; a falling down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> (syn.: casus, lapsus). </sense><sense id="n41985.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstracto. </sense><sense id="n41985.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n41985.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare). grandinis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra (sc. nucum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:25:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentorum sarcinarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>: Capanei, <hi rend="ital">a fall by lightning</hi> (v. Capaneus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 40: <cit><quote lang="la">(apri saevi) Permixtas dabant equitum peditumque ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1329</bibl></cit>: Tyrrhenus et Aconteus Conixi incurrunt hastis, primique ruinam Dant sonitu ingenti, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall upon each other</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 613</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea suspensa graves aulaea ruinas In patinam fecere,</quote> <trans><tr>fell down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41985.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of buildings, <hi rend="ital">a tumbling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falling down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">downfall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi> (class.; in good prose only in <number>sing.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">repentinā ruinā pars ejus turris concidit ... tum hostes, turris repentinā ruinā commoti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> and 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf.: ferunt conclave illud, ubi epularetur Scopas, concidisse: eā ruinā ipsum oppressum cum suis <cb n="RUMA" /> interiisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphitheatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta Penthei Disjecta non leni ruinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Deiphobi dedit ampla ruinam, Vulcano superante, domus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fell in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 310</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trahere ruinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 465</bibl></cit>; 9, 712; cf. B. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>, infra: <cit><quote lang="la">effulsisse inter ruinam ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinam urbis et incendia recordantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus, captivitas, ruina, ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos occidere incendii ac ruinae potentia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae in te impendent ruinae, nisi suffulcis firmiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35, 4</bibl> (with incendia); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fractus illabatur orbis, Impavidum ferient ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Capitolio dementes ruinas parabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41985.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a downfall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin; accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catastrophe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf.: exitium, pernicies). </sense><sense id="n41985.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illa fuit et, ut saepe jam dixi, ruina quaedam atque tempestas,</quote> <trans><tr>a catastrophe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 35, 96</bibl></cit>: incendium meum ruinā restinguam, <hi rend="ital">with the overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> (of the State), Catilina ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 9</bibl>, and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:25:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 25, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut communi ruinā patriae opprimerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:91:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 91, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:1" default="NO">2, 85, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:1" default="NO">2, 124, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac ruinā rerum stetit una integra atque immobilis virtus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum nostrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex loco superiore impetu facto, strage ac ruinā fudere Gallos,</quote> <trans><tr>utter defeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae similem stragem eques dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 66</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 46; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 47: ruina soceri in exsilium pulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereat sceleratus, regnique trahat patriaeque ruinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae gentes belli sequuntur ruinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille dies utramque Ducet ruinam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronis principis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 245</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n41985.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermitto ruinas fortunarum tuarum, quas omnes impendere tibi proximis Idibus senties,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ruinis aversae, atque afflictae rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devota morti pectora liberae Quantis fatigaret ruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox auget ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:207" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principiis in rerum fecere ruinas et graviter magni magno cecidere ibi casu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>false steps</tr>, <tr>errors</tr>, <tr>mistakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Academia) si invaserit in haec, miseras edet ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinas videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41985.8" n="II" level="1"> In concreto. </sense><sense id="n41985.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which tumbles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">falls down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fall</hi> (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n41985.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen. （<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">disjectam Aenaeae toto videt aequore classem Fluctibus oppressos Troas caelique ruinā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a storm</tr>, <tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 129</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caeli (with insani imbres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:251" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thunder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:334" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 334</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n41985.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">a building that has tumbled down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruins</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>, and not in Cic. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc humilis veteres tantummodo Troja ruinas ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sagunti ruinae nostris capitibus incident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(urbs) deserta ac strata prope omnis ruinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 38, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumantes Thebarum ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinis templorum templa aedificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tugurio ruinarum Carthaginiensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius par labor ... flumina ad lavandam hanc ruinam jugis montium ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">EX RVINA TEMPLI MARTIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2448</bibl></cit> (A.D. 256).—</sense><sense id="n41985.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons who cause ruin, <hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 51, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae publicanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruinosus: <entryFree id="n41986" type="main" key="ru^i_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ruina</etym>, of buildings. <sense id="n41986.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tumbling down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going to ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruinous</hi> (rare but class.): aedes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (better rimosos).—* </sense><sense id="n41986.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">that has already fallen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in ruins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinosas occulit herba domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭīnōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">ruins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instaurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:36:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 36, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rullus: <entryFree id="n41987" type="main" key="Rullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl>). So, P. Servilius Rullus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people in the consulate of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who directed against him three orations on the Agrarian law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruma: <entryFree id="n41987.1" type="gloss" key="ruma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, v. rumis.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n41988" type="main" key="ruma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, v. rumen. <cb n="RUMI" /></entryFree>
rumen: <entryFree id="n41989" type="main" key="ru_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 54</bibl>), <sense id="n41989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gullet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumen est pars colli, quā esca devoratur, unde rumare dicebatur, quod nunc ruminare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. ex Fest. s. v. adrumavit, p. 9 ib.: ruminatio dicta est a rumine eminente gutturis parte, per quam demissus cibus a certis revocatur animalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 1, 37</bibl>: dum sit, rumen qui impleam, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 16</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 153 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270, 28</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=9:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 9, 14</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
rumentum: <entryFree id="n41990" type="gloss" key="rumentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumentum</orth>, <itype>abruptio</itype>, Fest. pp. 270 and 271 Müll.</entryFree>
rumex: <entryFree id="n41991" type="main" key="ru^mex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n41991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a missile weapon</hi>, similar to the sparum of the Gauls, Lucil. ap. Fest. pp. 270 and 271 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n41992" type="main" key="ru^mex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n41992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sorrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:184" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 12, 60, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:231" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 21, 85, § 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 210, 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 134 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rumia: <entryFree id="n41993" type="main" key="Ru_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Rumina <sense id="n41993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rumifico: <entryFree id="n41994" type="hapax" key="ru_mi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rumor-facio</etym>, <sense id="n41994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make report; to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (sc. Alcumenam) cives Thebani vero rumificant probam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rumigeratio: <entryFree id="n41995" type="main" key="ru_mi^ge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭgĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rumigeror</etym>, <sense id="n41995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spreading of reports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proclaiming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumoring</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rumigeror: <entryFree id="n41996" type="main" key="ru_mi^ge^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭgĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n41996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [rumor-gero], <hi rend="ital">to spread reports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noise abroad</hi>, Fest. s. v. rumitant, p. 270 Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=271:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 271, 3</bibl> ib.: rumigerantium sermones, Schol. Bob. ad Cic. Or. de Aere Alien, 2 Fragm. 7, p. 344 Bait.</sense></entryFree>
rumigerulus: <entryFree id="n41997" type="main" key="ru_mi^ge^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭgĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rumigeror</etym>, <sense id="n41997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that spreads reports</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rumors; subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a newsmonger</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">50, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rumigo: <entryFree id="n41998" type="main" key="ru_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rumen-ago</etym>, <sense id="n41998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chew over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ruminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tertium qualum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 2</bibl></cit>: bos si non rumigat, Gargil. Mart. Cur. Boum. § 15.</sense></entryFree>
rumina: <entryFree id="n41999" type="main" key="Ru_mi_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmīna</orth> (in some MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rumis, qs. she that offers her breast</etym>, <sense id="n41999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess of nursing mothers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was worshipped in a separate temple near the fig-tree under which Romulus and Remus had sucked the breast</hi> (rumis) <hi rend="ital">of the shewolf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 5</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 30 sq.</bibl> (v. the passages under rumis); Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11; 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 11.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n41999.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>the fig-tree of Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1,4,5</bibl></cit> (where,from a false etymology, the earlier form is said to have been Rumularis, Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 90</bibl>: alii a Romulo velint dictam quasi Romularem); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. 20" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 400</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 54</bibl> Müll.—By <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license, it is also called, </sense><sense id="n41999.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmĭna</orth> <itype>ficus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:412" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 412</bibl> (where, as above in Liv., from a false etymology, a pretended older form, Romula, is given).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42000" type="main" key="Ru_mi^na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmĭna</orth>, <itype>ficus</itype>, v. 1. Rumina, B.</entryFree>
ruminalis: <entryFree id="n42001" type="main" key="Ru_mi^na_lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>ficus</itype>, v. 1. Rumina, A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42002" type="hapax" key="ru_mi^na_lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rumen</etym>, <sense id="n42002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chewing again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruminating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruminatio: <entryFree id="n42003" type="main" key="ru_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>ruminor</etym>, <sense id="n42003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chewing over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chewing the cud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumination.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42003.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a doubling; a repetition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">return</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 191</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42003.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thinking over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving in the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruminating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruminator: <entryFree id="n42004" type="main" key="ru_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that chews again</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruminates</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruminor: <entryFree id="n42005" type="main" key="ru_mi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n42005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, and (after the Aug. period) <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [rumen], <hi rend="ital">to chew over again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chew the cud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ruminate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42005.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42005.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos ruminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 29, § 62 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42005.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) ruminat herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">revocatas herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epastas herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hal. 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">escas gutture,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 340</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42005.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to muse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruminate upon</hi> (only anteand post-class.; but cf. ruminatio): nemo haec ruminetur mulieri, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 29</bibl>: ruminabitur humanitatem, <pb n="1605" /> <cb n="RUMO" /> Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Odyssean Homeri ruminari incipis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 480, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruminaris antiquitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 480, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum carmina tua ruminas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ruminus: <entryFree id="n42006" type="main" key="Ru_mi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūmīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rumis, analog. to 1. Rumina</etym>, <sense id="n42006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the nourisher of all things</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 11.</sense></entryFree>
rumis: <entryFree id="n42007" type="gloss" key="rumis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (collat. form † <orth extent="full" lang="la">ruma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n42007.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>),<gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a breast that gives suck; a teat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dug</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parum habet lactis mater, ut subiciat sub alterius mammam, qui appellantur subrumi, id est sub mammā: antiquo enim vocabulo mamma rumis, ut opinor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: non negarim, ideo apud divae Ruminae sacellum a pastoribus satam ficum. Ibi enim solent sacrificari lacte pro vino et pro lactentibus. Mammae enim rumis sive rumae, ut ante dicebant, a rumi; <cit><quote lang="la">et inde dicuntur subrumi agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: hisce manibus lacte fit, non vino, Cuninae propter cunas, Ruminae propter rumam, id est prisco vocabulo mammam, a quo subrumi etiam nunc dicuntur agni, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 30 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamma rumis dicitur, unde et rustici appellant haedos subrumos, qui adhuc sub mammis habentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=271:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 271, 4</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sub eā (ficu) inventa est lupa infantibus praebens rumim (ita vocabant mammam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rumito: <entryFree id="n42008" type="hapax" key="ru_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n42008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [rumo, rumor], <hi rend="ital">to spread reports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rumor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumitant, rumigerantur. Naevius: simul alius aliunde rumitant inter sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
rumo: <entryFree id="n42009" type="gloss" key="rumo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumo</orth>, <itype>āre, for rumino</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=271:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 271, 3</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
rumor: <entryFree id="n42010" type="main" key="ru_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)ru/w,</foreign> to howl; <foreign lang="greek">o)rumagdo/s,</foreign> din; Sanscr. root ru-, roar; ravas, uproar; Lat.: raucus, rudo</etym>. <sense id="n42010.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the talk of the many</hi>, whether relating facts or expressing opinions. </sense><sense id="n42010.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Common talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unauthenticated report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hearsay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rumor</hi> (the prevalent and class. signif.; used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; syn.: fama, sermo); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with a mention of its purport. </sense><sense id="n42010.2" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: est hoc Gallicae consuetudinis, uti mercatores in oppidis vulgus circumsistat, quibusque ex regionibus veniant quasque ibi res cognoverint, pronuntiare cogant. His rumoribus atque auditionibus permoti de summis saepe rebus consilia ineunt, quorum eos e vestigio poenitere necesse est; <cit><quote lang="la">cum incertis rumoribus serviant, et plerique ad voluntatem eorum ficta respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid rumore ac famā accipere ... falsis rumoribus terreri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa rumor perferet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, in the description of the house of Fame, in Ovid: mixtaque cum veris passim commenta vagantur Milia rumorum confusaque verba volutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 55</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in its connection): <cit><quote lang="la">rumoribus mecum pugnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores Africanos excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus vulgi rumoribus exagitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa rumor fingebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addunt et affingunt rumoribus Galli, quod res poscere videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus a Rostris manat per compita rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 50</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n42010.3" n="b" level="4"> With the purport of the rumor introduced by an <hi rend="ital">object-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relative-clause;</hi> by <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, rarely by <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42010.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Postquam populi rumorem intelleximus, Studiose expetere vos Plautinas fabulas, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 11</bibl>: cum interea rumor venit, Datum iri gladiatores; populus convolat, etc., Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebri ad eum rumores afferebantur litterisque item Labieni certior fiebat, omnes Belgas contra populum Romanum conjurare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum gnatum rumor est amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem te valde bene gessisse rumor erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit hic rumor: Scis tu illum accusationem cogitare? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro vulgi rumore lacerabatur, tamquam viros et insontes ob invidiam aut metum exstinxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdito rumore, tamquam Mesopotamiam invasurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42010.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil perfertur ad nos praeter rumores de oppresso Dolabellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Aeduorum defectione rumores afferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vitā imperatoris dubii rumores allati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves de te rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinctis rumoribus de auxiliis legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <cb n="RUMP" /> </sense><sense id="n42010.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cenae rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli civilis rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: rumor prostratae regi pudicitiae <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42010.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">current report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the popular voice;</hi> and objectively, <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi> (less freq. but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">famam atque rumores pars altera consensum civitatis et velut publicum testimonium vocat: altera sermonem sine ullo certo auctore dispersum, cui malignitas initium dederit, incrementum credulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus famam rumoresque hominum si satis firmus steteris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui erit rumor populi, si id feceris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam opinionem (populi) parva nonnumquam commutat aura rumoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17, 35</bibl></cit>: rumoribus adversa in pravitatem, secunda in casum, fortunam in temeritatem, declinando corrumpebant, <hi rend="ital">with their slanders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misrepresentations</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos rumor asperserat, ii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:31:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 31, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem quendam et plausum popularem esse quaesitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 47, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumori servire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin, 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. in the lusus verbb. with <hi rend="ital">rumen</hi>: ego rumorem parvi facio, dum sit rumen qui impleam, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem infimae plebis rumorem affectavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus adverso rumore esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagret rumore malo cum Hic atque ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: invidiam alicui concitare secundo populi rumore, <hi rend="ital">with the concurring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favorable judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the approbation</hi>, Fenest. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 17</bibl>; so, rumore secundo, Suev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>; old poet in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 16, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid accipere secundo rumore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claro apud volgum rumore erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42010.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a murmuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmur</hi> of a stream: <cit><quote lang="la">amoena fluenta Subterlabentis tacito rumore Mosellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rumpia: <entryFree id="n42011" type="main" key="rumpi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. rhomphaea <sense id="n42011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rumpo: <entryFree id="n42012" type="main" key="rumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum</itype> (<sense id="n42012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> paragog. rumpier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. 127" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. 127</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root rup</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rupture; to break asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force open</hi>, etc. (very freq. and class.; a favorite word of the Aug. poets; cf. frango). </sense><sense id="n42012.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: SI MEMBRVM RVPIT NI CVM EO PACIT TALIO ESTO, Lex XII. Tab. ap. Fest. S. V. TALIO, p. 274; and ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 14</bibl>; cf. Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 710</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:233 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 233 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena pudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstantia claustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teretes plagas (aper),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rupti torrentibus pontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem aceto (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:135" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbum (aqua),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinam (sinus Noto remugiens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenta cubilia tectaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues a pectore vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus pariterque capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum ruptum aut turbata cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to penetrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">guttura cultro,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem (vis venti),</quote> <trans><tr>to sunder</tr>, <tr>rive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen nubes rumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:58:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus rumpit nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:54:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptae nubes et in pronum solutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 5:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 135</bibl></cit>: turbo ruptus, <hi rend="ital">breaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bursting forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 416</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā causā rupi ramices,</quote> <trans><tr>burst</tr>, <tr>ruptured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos ramices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inflatas vesiculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora fremitu (leones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius immensae ruperunt horrea messes,</quote> <trans><tr>filled to repletion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:307" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 307</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugibus rupta congestis horrea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:7" default="NO" valid="yes">80, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 26</bibl>; cf. with a <hi rend="ital">personal object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupit Iarbitam Timagenis aemula lingua, Dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 15</bibl></cit>.—Esp. reflexively, <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">split one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">me rupi causā currendo tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 14</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 88, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">382, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me ambulando rumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, si te ruperis, Par eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 319</bibl></cit>.— Mid.: ego misera risu clandestino rumpier, <hi rend="ital">to burst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 382, 21</bibl> (Com. <cb n="RUMP" /> Rel. p. 154 Rib.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus in pratis cantando rumpitur anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (licentiā audacium) ante rumpebar, nunc ne movear quidem,</quote> <trans><tr>could have burst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et inflatas rumpi vesiculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpantur iniqui, Vicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser Rumperis (sc. irā) et latras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 136</bibl></cit>: rumpere viam, iter, etc., <hi rend="ital">to force a passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way by force</hi>: ferro rumpenda per hostes Est via, <hi rend="ital">a passage must be burst</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forced through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 372</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo nisi corporibus armisque rupere cuneo viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupta via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:469" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 196</bibl></cit> (with reserare viam); <cit><quote lang="la">15, 782: Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupto sonuit sacer aequore Titan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:37" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:568" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 568</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere media agmina,</quote> <trans><tr>to burst through</tr>, <tr>break through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 683</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia misso equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:64" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 64</bibl></cit> (4, 10, 62): <cit><quote lang="la">ruptā mersum caput obruit undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5"
