default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnantibus acies rumpenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvos hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:616" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to break open</tr>, <tr>cause to break forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes abyssae magnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: se rumpere, <hi rend="ital">to break out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst forth</hi> ( = erumpere): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sub lucem densa inter nubila sese Diversi rumpent radii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus se nubibus imber Ruperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde altus primum se erumpit Enipeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 368</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rumpi, in mid. force: dum amnes ulli rumpuntur fontibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui reditum,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: offendit, fregit, rumpit, icit poculo, <hi rend="ital">wounds</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 173 Rib.); so, si quis rumpet occidetve insciens ne fraus esto, an ancient form of rogation in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 17</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42012.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc quisquam ... foedera scientem neglexisse, violasse, rupisse dicere audebit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">foedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 40, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramenti religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverentiam sacramenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem induciarum, pacis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium jus et sacra legationis et fas gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationes vos rogatas rumpitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:780" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 780</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat, agnascendo rumpi testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>is made void</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 241</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jura testamentorum ruptorum aut ratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 882</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati necessitatem humanis consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me e somno excitetis et rumpatis visum,</quote> <trans><tr>break in upon</tr>, <tr>interrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 458</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vero amplexus fessi rupere supremos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:32" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitu silentia rumpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia (verbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 598</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:85" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:509" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 509</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutinum silentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 239, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en age, segnes Rumpe moras,</quote> <trans><tr>break off</tr>, <tr>end delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rumpe moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 583</bibl> Bach, <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:306" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 306</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 11, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpunt moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:813" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 813</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: rumpit has imo pectore voces, <hi rend="ital">breaks forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaks out in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gives vent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utters</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 377</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 129</bibl></cit>; 3, 246; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:301" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 301</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 553</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 249</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:458" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 458</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rumpotinetum: <entryFree id="n42013" type="hapax" key="rumpo_ti^ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpōtĭnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rumpotinus</etym>, <sense id="n42013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place planted with low trees to support the vines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rumpotinus: <entryFree id="n42014" type="main" key="rumpo_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rumpus-teneo</etym>. <sense id="n42014.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That serves to support the running vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus arbusti Gallici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42014.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpōtĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of maple</hi> (opulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:172" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 112, § 172</bibl>. <pb n="1606" /> <cb n="RUO" /></sense></entryFree>
rumpus: <entryFree id="n42015" type="main" key="rumpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rumpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runner</hi> (syn. tradux), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rumusculus: <entryFree id="n42016" type="main" key="ru_muscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūmuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rumor</etym>, <sense id="n42016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">idle talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common gossip</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">qui imperitorum hominum rumusculos aucupati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cassio omnes rumusculos populari ratione aucupante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
runa: <entryFree id="n42017" type="main" key="ru_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of weapon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a javelin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">runa genus teli significat. Ennius: runata recedit, id est pilata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=263" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 263</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Gracchus runis et iis sicis, quas, etc.... nonne omnem rei publicae statum permutavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n42017.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the runic written character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">runes</hi>: barbara fraxineis pingatur runa tabellis, Ven. Carm. 7, 18, 19.</sense></entryFree>
runatus: <entryFree id="n42018" type="main" key="ru_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. runa, I.</entryFree>
runcatio: <entryFree id="n42019" type="main" key="runca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>runco</etym>. <sense id="n42019.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A weeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weeding out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:19" default="NO">2, 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 185</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42019.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">weeds</hi> to be pulled out, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
runcator: <entryFree id="n42020" type="main" key="runca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weeder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:19" default="NO">11, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
runcina: <entryFree id="n42021" type="main" key="runci_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">r(uka/nh</foreign>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 96</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n42021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 44, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42022" type="main" key="Runci_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Runcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. runco</etym>, <sense id="n42022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rural goddess presiding over weeding</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
runcino: <entryFree id="n42023" type="main" key="runci_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runcīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. runcina</etym>, <sense id="n42023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plane off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=96" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 96</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 177</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42023.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, com.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum probe jam oneratum runcinabo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will take in</tr>, <tr>cheat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
runco: <entryFree id="n42024" type="main" key="runco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>runca, runcina</etym>, <sense id="n42024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weed out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">root up; to weed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear of weeds.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42024.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:40" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42024.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n42024.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of its hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 35</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42024.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mow</hi>: frumenta, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42025" type="main" key="runco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">runco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. runco</etym>, <sense id="n42025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weedinghook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grubbing-hoe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruo: <entryFree id="n42026" type="main" key="ru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ŭtum</itype> (ruiturus, a, um, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 459</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 404</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 19, 8</bibl>; <sense id="n42026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> ruentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 886</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall with violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush down; to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumble down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go to ruin</hi> (cf.: labor, procumbo, cado). </sense><sense id="n42026.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42026.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Rarely of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">caedebant pariter pariterque ruebant Victores victique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 756</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:642" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 642</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ruere illa non possunt, ut haec non eodem labefacta motu concidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula runnt,</quote> <trans><tr>fell down</tr>, <tr>tumbled down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tecta (supra aliquem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 403</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:68 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 68 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles et machina mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aulaea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus latius quam caederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silices a montibus altis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto a culmine Troja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 290</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1105</bibl></cit>: ruit arduus aether, <hi rend="ital">it rains</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the rain descends in torrents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 324</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum imbribus immodicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:100:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 100, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruit imbriferum ver,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>is ending</tr>, <tr>hastening to its close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 313</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus imber aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n42026.3" n="1" level="3"> Prov.: caelum ruit, <hi rend="ital">the sky is falling;</hi> of any thing very improbable: <hi rend="ital">Cl.</hi> Quid tum, quaeso, si hoc pater resciverit? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Quid si nunc caelum ruat? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 41</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42026.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of rapid, hasty movements, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volo, curro): id ne ferae quidem faciunt, ut ita ruant atque turbentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeium) ruere nuntiant et jam jamque adesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc omnis turba ruebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneadae in ferrum ruebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per proelia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam inermes ultro ruere ac se morti offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contis gladiisque ruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquam caeci ruebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra fugientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: in vulnera ac tela, id. <cb n="RUO" /> 26, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">promiscue in concubitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques pedesque certatim portis ruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem infesto agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per vias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destinatā morte in proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruebant laxatis habenis aurigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de montibus amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina per campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliam Rhenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of time: <cit><quote lang="la">vertitur interea caelum et ruit Oceano Nox,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>hastens up</tr>, <tr>sets in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revoluta ruebat dies,</quote> <trans><tr>was advancing</tr>, <tr>hastening on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 256</bibl></cit>; cf. of the <hi rend="ital">setting</hi> of the sun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:274" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 274</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 136, 19</bibl>.— Of sound, <hi rend="ital">to break forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum, unde ruunt totidem voces, responsa Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42026.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42026.6" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio ruat omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum accidunt nemo est quin intellegat, ruere illam rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellium ne prosperis quidem parem, adeo ruentibus debilitatum,</quote> <trans><tr>by his falling fortunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam florentes Atheniensium opes ruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42026.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to A. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To rush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam ad interitum ruerem voluntarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Marcell. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emptorem pati ruere et per errorem in maximam fraudem incurrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to act hastily</tr>, <tr>commit an oversight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cotidie rueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">compescere ruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 63</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad seditiones et discordias et bella civilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatis odio in crudelitatem ruitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sua fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fatis In pejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo scelesti ruitis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ruis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 811</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 428</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos video, quā vel impudentiā vel fames duxit, ruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ruis imprudens, vage, dicere fata?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 71: <cit><quote lang="la">scire ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 751</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:177" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 387</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferme fugiendo in media fata ruitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42026.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cast down with violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dash down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tumble down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (except the jurid. phrase ruta caesa, perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, for in the passage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 15, 2</bibl>, seu ruet seu eriget rem publicam, ruet might be neutr.) </sense><sense id="n42026.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres fluctusque ... frangere malum, Ruere antennas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves (vis venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res impetibus crebris (venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros ruerem, agerem, raperem, funderem et prosternerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanem molem volvuntque ruuntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulos ruit pinguis harenae,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks down</tr>, <tr>levels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 105</bibl></cit>: sese superne in praedam, <hi rend="ital">to cast one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self upon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 341, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42026.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">to cast up</hi> from the bottom, <hi rend="ital">to turn up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rake up</hi>: cum mare permotum ventis, ruit intus harenam, <hi rend="ital">casts up</hi> (syn. eruit), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 726</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum (mare) a sedibus imis (venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumas salis aere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem et confusa Ossa focis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atram nubem ad caelum (ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Divitias aerisque ruam, dic, augur, acervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, found only in the phrase rūta et caesa or rūta caesa (acc. to Varro, the u was pronounced long, although it is short in the compounds erutus, obrutus, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in venditionis lege fundi ruta caesa ita dicimus, ut U producamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 104</bibl></cit>).—In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">every thing dug up</hi> (ruta) <hi rend="ital">and cut down</hi> (caesa) <hi rend="ital">on an estate without being wrought</hi>, and which is reserved by the owner at a sale; <hi rend="ital">the timber and minerals</hi>: si ruta et caesa excipiantur in venditione, ea placuit esse ruta, quae eruta sunt, ut harena, creta et similia; <cit><quote lang="la">caesa ea esse, ut arbores caesas, et carbones et his similia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rutis caesis ea sunt, quae terrā non tenentur, quaeque opere structili tectoriove non continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:241" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta caesa dicuntur, quae venditor possessionis sui usus gratiā concidit ruendoque contraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut venditores, cum aedes fundumve vendiderint rutis caesis receptis, concedant tamen aliquid emptori, quod ornandi causā apte et loco positum esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: dicet <cb n="RURO" /> te ne in rutis quidem et caesis solium tibl fraternum recepisse, Crass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rupa: <entryFree id="n42027" type="main" key="ru_pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, v. rupes <sense id="n42027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rupes: <entryFree id="n42028" type="main" key="ru_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 72</bibl> Hildebr. min.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Isid.</author> p. 693</bibl>),<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rumpo</etym>, <sense id="n42028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnis rupibus nactus planitiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (oppidum) ex omnibus in circuitu partibus altissimas rupes despectusque haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: inter saxa rupesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex rupe Tarpeiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnasia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:293" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavae,</quote> <trans><tr>caverns</tr>, <tr>grottos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 253</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ima (Sibyllae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 443</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a cliff</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 693</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:108" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:637" default="NO">4, 637</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">personantibus et respondentibus inter se rupibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:6:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rupex: <entryFree id="n42029" type="main" key="ru^pex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭpex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated man; a boor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clown</hi> (ante- and postclass., and mostly in the <number>plur.</number>), Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. squarrosi, pp. 328 and 329 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl> (cf. rupico).</sense></entryFree>
rupicapra: <entryFree id="n42030" type="main" key="ru_pi^ca^pra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūpĭ-căpra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rupes</etym>, <sense id="n42030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chamois</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 45, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:231" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 231</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rupico: <entryFree id="n42031" type="hapax" key="ru^pi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭpĭco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rupex</etym>, for rupex, <sense id="n42031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boorish man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 344, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rupilius: <entryFree id="n42032" type="main" key="Ru^pi^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭpĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n42032.1" n="A" level="2"> P. Rupilius, <hi rend="ital">consul with</hi> Popillius Laenas, A. U. C. 622, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">from him proceed the Leges Rupiliae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Rupilius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, § 59</bibl>; 50, § 125; 2, 3, 40, § 92.—</sense><sense id="n42032.2" n="B" level="2"> A. Rupilius, <hi rend="ital">a physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 176</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42032.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An actor in Cicero</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s youth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42032.4" n="D" level="2"> P. Rupilius Rex, <hi rend="ital">a native of Prœneste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Horace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proscribed by Octavian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 1</bibl> Schol. Cruq.</sense></entryFree>
rupina: <entryFree id="n42033" type="main" key="ru_pi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūpīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rupes</etym>, <sense id="n42033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleft of a rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rocky chasm</hi> (Appuleian), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 193 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ruptio: <entryFree id="n42034" type="main" key="rupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rumpo</etym>, <sense id="n42034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fracture; an injuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruptor: <entryFree id="n42035" type="main" key="ruptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaker</hi> (not ante-Aug.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: foederis,</quote> <trans><tr>a violator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit> (with violator juris); 1, 28; 21, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: 25, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruptura: <entryFree id="n42036" type="main" key="ruptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fracture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breach</hi>, of a limb or vein, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:33" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 65, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruptus: <entryFree id="n42037" type="main" key="ruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of rumpo.</entryFree>
ruralis: <entryFree id="n42038" type="main" key="ru_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rus</etym>, <sense id="n42038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus (Hesiodi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rurally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruratio: <entryFree id="n42039" type="main" key="ru_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>ruro</etym>, <sense id="n42039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country life</hi> (Appuleian), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 310, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 2, p. 350, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rurestris: <entryFree id="n42040" type="main" key="ru_restris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rus</etym>, <sense id="n42040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:99" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 65, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 194: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 143: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ruricola: <entryFree id="n42041" type="main" key="ru_ri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n42041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. gen. omn.</hi> [rus-colo], <hi rend="ital">that tills the ground; that lives in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belongs to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 384</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:392" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Priapus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hoes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 859</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formicula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42041.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrĭcŏ-la</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42041.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A tiller of the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a husbandman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi> (syn. colonus); <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:337" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 337</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 52</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42041.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An ox</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bull</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruricolaris: <entryFree id="n42042" type="main" key="ru_ri^co^la_ri^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrĭcŏlārĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ruricola</etym>, <sense id="n42042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>: cultor, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:325" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rurigena: <entryFree id="n42043" type="hapax" key="ru_ri^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūrĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n42043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one born in the country; a countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 765</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rurina: <entryFree id="n42044" type="main" key="Ru_ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūrīna</orth> (or, in the old orthog., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rū-sīna</orth>; <sense id="n42044.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">S</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>rus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess that presided over agriculture</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
ruro: <entryFree id="n42045" type="main" key="ru_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n42045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to live in the country</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. passages): dum ruri rurant <pb n="1607" /> <cb n="RURS" /> homines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 16</bibl>: dum in agro ruror, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rursus: <entryFree id="n42046" type="main" key="rursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rursus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rursum</orth>, and arch. <orth extent="full" lang="la">rūsum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">russum</orth> (rursum and rusum are the most usual forms in the ante-class., and rursus in the class. per.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from revorsus or revorsum, from reverto; cf. prorsus and sursum</etym>, <sense id="n42046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi> (opp. prorsus): rursus retro, Non. </sense><sense id="n42046.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only ante-class.): rursus prorsus reciprocat fluctus feram, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 11</bibl>, and 384 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (Trag. v. 143 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidari sentio et cursari rursum prorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: mortales multi rursus ac prorsus meant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 384, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex alto puteo sursum ad summum escenderis, Maximum periculum inde esse, a summo ne rursum cadas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cunas recessim rursum vorsum trahere et ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42046.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42046.3" n="A" level="2"> To indicate the reverse of something, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the other hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in return</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi> (freq. in all periods and kinds of composition; syn.: retro, contra, in vicem): in hominum aetate multa eveniunt hujusmodi: Capiunt voluptates: capiunt rursum miserias; <cit><quote lang="la">Irae interveniunt, redeunt rursum in gratiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:58 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 58 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum, pax rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid dicunt, laudo: id rursum si negant laudo id quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Salutat. <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Saluta hunc rursus Punice meis verbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe a me rursum rationem doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succurrit Pulfioni Varenus et laboranti subvenit... Huic (Vareno) rursus circumvento fert subsidium Pulfio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos ipse rursus singulos exceptans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 47</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore sublato excipit rursus ex vallo clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam luxu atque desidiā civitas corrupta est, rursus respublica magnitudine suā imperatorum vitia sustentabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 53, 5</bibl></cit>: primum Metellum esse rati, portas clausere; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde rursus Jugurtham arbitrati obvii procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 69, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illae superiores (partes) in medium locum mundi gravitate ferantur, sic hae rursum rectis lineis in caelestem locum subvolent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum totam terram contueri licebit ... tum et habitabiles regiones et rursum omni cultu propter vim frigoris vacantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (Gorgias) judicaret hoc oratoris esse maxime proprium, rem augere posse laudando vituperandoque rursus affligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse erit cupere et optare ... rursus autem recte factis angi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque rursum eam totam repudiaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:24:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 24, 110</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">neque rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO">2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO">10, 3, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 5, 4: Iliacos intra muros peccatur et extra. Rursus, quid virtus et quid sapientia possit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequum est, Peccatis veniam poscentem reddere rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his, rursus illis exitiabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence sometimes with <hi rend="ital">retro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invicem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concede, nihil esse bonum, nisi, etc.... Vide rursus retro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi rursus invicem anno post in armis sunt: illi domi remanent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicorum vitiis tam cernis acutum? etc. At tibi contra Evenit, inquirant vitia ut tua rursus et illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42046.4" n="B" level="2"> Denoting return to a former action or its repetition, <hi rend="ital">back again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anew</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum, denuo): em rursum nunc nugas agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Peliam) Medea dicitur Fecisse rursus ex sene adulescentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uti quidque in sua corpora rursum Dissolvat natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem gigni rursusque augescere dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obloquere rursum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feri malam tu illi rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te suam (causam) rogavit rursum ut ageres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo loco, si tibi hoc sumis ... facis, ut rursus plebes in Aventinum sevocanda esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii, qui in montem sese receperant, rursus instare et proelium redintegrare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: bellum inferre, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">confligere cum Bruti classe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga vertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus minuente aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 40</bibl> Müll.: rursus aliam in partem fugam petebant,<cb n="RUSO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">has (cohortes) subsidiariae ternae, et rursus aliae totidem, suae cujusque legionis, subsequebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 103, 2</bibl>. —In beginning a new strophe (= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/lin</foreign>): rursus, et hoc iterum repetamus carmen, Val. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Dir. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> Dir. 14</bibl>.—Pleon., with <hi rend="ital">denuo</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Diphilus hanc Graece scripsit, post id rursum denuo Latine Plautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revortor rursus denuo Karthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 79</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 35.—Freq. with words compounded with <hi rend="ital">re;</hi> like reverti, regredi, se recipere, reducere, revocare, etc., v. h. vv.</sense></entryFree>
rus: <entryFree id="n42047" type="main" key="ru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūs</orth>, <itype>rūris</itype> (used in the <number>plur.</number> only in <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Zend. ravanh, broad, free; ravan, a plain; Germ. Raum, space</etym>, <sense id="n42047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the country</hi> (opp. to the city), <hi rend="ital">lands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fields; a country-seat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus, praedia): pascua reddere rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1248</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudato ingentia rura, Exiguum colito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspera dumis Rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterna rura bobus exercet suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsita pomis Rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coli rura ab ergastulis pessimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet animi causā rus amoenum et suburbanum,</quote> <trans><tr>a country-seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rus urbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe relictā rura peragrantes saepe soli sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 40</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus, in answer to the question whither? quom rus homines eunt,</quote> <trans><tr>to their country - seats</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure redire,</quote> <trans><tr>from the farm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18</bibl>; 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 45</bibl> et saep.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rure venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure huc advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adveniens mater rure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, less freq.: ruri redire, venire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus plaustrorum in aedibus Videas, quam ruri,</quote> <trans><tr>in the country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illi sunt virgae ruri, at mihi tergum domi'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 131</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ruri (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 400),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 68</bibl>; 4, 2, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 47 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq.: rure esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 115</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">mori rure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 229</bibl>.—With an <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure paterno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rure suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:671" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 671</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex meo propinquo rure hoc capio commodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rusadir: <entryFree id="n42048" type="main" key="Rusa^dir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rusădir</orth>, v. Rhysaddir.</entryFree>
rusca: <entryFree id="n42049" type="main" key="Rusca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rusca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the Pinarian family</hi>: M. Rusca, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, A.U.C. 622, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruscarius: <entryFree id="n42050" type="main" key="rusca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruscārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rustārĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ruscum</etym>, <sense id="n42050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for butcher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-broom</hi>: falculae, <hi rend="ital">for weeding out butcher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-broom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruscino: <entryFree id="n42051" type="main" key="Rusci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ruscĭno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Gallia Narbonensis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pyrenees</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Perpignan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rusco: <entryFree id="n42052" type="hapax" key="rusco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rusco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">rusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ruscum</etym>, <sense id="n42052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clear of butcher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-broom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42053" type="main" key="rusco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rusco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of cattle</hi>, Gargil. Mart. de Cur. Boum.</sense></entryFree>
rusculum: <entryFree id="n42054" type="hapax" key="ruscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rus</etym>, <sense id="n42054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little country-seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">farm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruscum: <entryFree id="n42055" type="main" key="ruscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruscum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">rustum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">butcher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">sbroom</hi>: Ruscus aculeatus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 50, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:100:section=173" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 100, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:166" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 9, 83, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 413</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:374" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 374</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
