rusellae: <entryFree id="n42056" type="main" key="Ru_sellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsellae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rōsell-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rosello.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsel-lānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rōsell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rusellœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes">37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsel-lāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Rusellœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
rusgada: <entryFree id="n42057" type="main" key="Rusga_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rusgāda</orth>, v. Rhysaddir.</entryFree>
rusiccade: <entryFree id="n42058" type="main" key="Ru_si^cca_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsĭccādē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 3, 2, § 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rusina: <entryFree id="n42059" type="main" key="Ru_si_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Rurina.</entryFree>
ruso: <entryFree id="n42060" type="main" key="Ruso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ruso</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. Abudius.</entryFree>
rusor: <entryFree id="n42061" type="main" key="Ru_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rusus for rursus; cf. susum</etym>, <sense id="n42061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a divinity that provides for the regular return of all productions</hi>: quod rursus cuncta eodem revolvuntur, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 23. <cb n="RUST" /></sense></entryFree>
ruspina: <entryFree id="n42062" type="main" key="Ruspi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ruspĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Zeugitana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 10, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruspor: <entryFree id="n42063" type="main" key="ruspor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ruspor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n42063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to search through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebro quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=264" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 264</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 19</bibl></cit> (anteclass.): ut latebras ruspans rimarem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=265" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 265</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 209 Rib.); cf.: vagent ruspantes silvas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube nunc animo ruspari Phrygas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
russatus: <entryFree id="n42064" type="main" key="russa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>russus</etym>, <sense id="n42064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a designation of one of the parties of charioteers in the circus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42064.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">factio, v. factio: auriga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 186</bibl></cit> (al. russei).—* </sense><sense id="n42064.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine suo russatus,</quote> <trans><tr>red</tr>, <tr>reddened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. Mil. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
russeolus: <entryFree id="n42065" type="hapax" key="russe^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [russeus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: sanies, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 11, 130.</sense></entryFree>
russesco: <entryFree id="n42066" type="hapax" key="russesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n42066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [russus], <hi rend="ital">to become red</hi>: russescunt frundes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 105</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 266 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
russeus: <entryFree id="n42067" type="main" key="russe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reddish</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:64" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 17, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
russulus: <entryFree id="n42068" type="main" key="russu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciolae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: tunicae, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
russus: <entryFree id="n42069" type="main" key="russus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">russus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">red</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gingiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 19</bibl></cit>: tunicae, Val. Imp. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rustarius: <entryFree id="n42070" type="main" key="rusta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ruscarius.</entryFree>
rustica: <entryFree id="n42071" type="main" key="rusti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. rusticus, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
rusticanus: <entryFree id="n42072" type="main" key="rusti^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rusticus</etym>, <sense id="n42072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country-</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines ex municipiis rusticanis ... rusticana relegatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines rusticani ex municipiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">34: multum mecum municipales homines loquuntur, multum rusticani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod loquitur priscum visum iri putat, si plane fuerit rusticanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: tugurium, <hi rend="ital">a peasant</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rusticatim: <entryFree id="n42073" type="hapax" key="rusti^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>rusticor</etym>, <sense id="n42073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rustically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi>: rustice, Non.: ego rusticatim tangam, urbanatim nescio, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rusticatio: <entryFree id="n42074" type="main" key="rusti^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42074.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A living in the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque militia solum, sed etiam peregrinationes rusticationesque communes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42074.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Agriculture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husbandry</hi>, Col. praef. § 13; 1, 1, 6; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 1, 6: creata ab Altissimo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rustice: <entryFree id="n42075" type="main" key="rusti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. rusticus <sense id="n42075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rusticellus: <entryFree id="n42076" type="hapax" key="rusti^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rusticulus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat rustic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clownish</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rusticitas: <entryFree id="n42077" type="main" key="rusti^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rusticus</etym> (not anteAug.). <sense id="n42077.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42077.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Country life and occupations</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husbandry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42077.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">country people</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 55, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42077.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the manners of the country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of country people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic behavior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rusticity</hi> (opp. urbanitas); <cit><quote lang="la">in a good and (more freq.) in a bad sense: patria est ei Brixia, ex illā nostrā Italiā, quae multum adhuc verecundiae, frugalitatis atque etiam rusticitatis antiquae retinet ac servat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 9, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 4</bibl>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus adest, nec nostros mansit in annos Rusticitas priscis illa superstes avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticitas, non pudor ille fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:672" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus sine rusticitate pudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(urbanitas) cui contraria sit rusticitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et imperitia, et rusticitas, et rigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (ore) nulla neque rusticitas neque peregrinitas resonet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum atque ipsius etiam soni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem rusticitatis arguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorare propter rusticitatem jus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
rusticola: <entryFree id="n42078" type="main" key="rusti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n42078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of the country</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Misc. 5, 5, 107.</sense></entryFree>
rusticor: <entryFree id="n42079" type="main" key="rusti^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n42079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [rusticus]. </sense><sense id="n42079.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to live in the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rusticate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42079.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">socerum suum Laelium semper fere cum Scipione solitum rusticari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: sin rusticatur, id <pb n="1608" /> <cb n="RUTA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies ad rusticandum dati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Leg. 1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(haec studia) pernoctant nobiscum, peregrinantur, rusticantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42079.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., econom. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to practise husbandry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to till the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be a farmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:8" default="NO">12, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42079.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to talk in a rustic manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk like a peasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varrones, Terentius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rusticulus: <entryFree id="n42080" type="main" key="rusti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [rusticus], <hi rend="ital">rather rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat coarse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42080.1" n="I" level="1"> Libellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (Bissula),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Carm. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42080.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n42080.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcŭ-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little rustic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42080.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little heath-cock;</hi> (cf. rustica, s. v. rusticus, I. B. 2. b.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 38, 54, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 76</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rusticus: <entryFree id="n42081" type="main" key="rusti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rus</etym>, <sense id="n42081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country-</hi> (very freq. and class.; syn. agrestis; opp. urbanus). </sense><sense id="n42081.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vita haec rustica, quam tu agrestem vocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae vitae hominum, rustica et urbana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani (opp. urbani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § 1; cf. plebes (opp. urbana), Col. praef. § 17; <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 58, 249</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. praef. § 19 sq.: homo (with agricola),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:645" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 645</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Phidyle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus (opp. urbanus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <trans><tr>heathcocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 1 sq.</bibl> (cf. infra, B. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:534" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria versibus alternis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42081.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42081.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ru-stĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a countryman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peasant;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: rustici, <hi rend="ital">country people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbani fiunt rustici, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Mere. 4, 3, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes urbani, rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">semper occant prius quam sarriunt rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10" default="NO">9, 10</bibl> et saep.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 699</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:68" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 17, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42081.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">rustĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42081.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A country girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 583</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42081.6" n="b" level="4"> (Sc. gallina.) <hi rend="ital">A heath-cock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 76</bibl> (cf. supra, A., and rusticulus, II. B.).—</sense><sense id="n42081.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">countrylike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, in a good or (more freq.) in a bad sense, i. e. <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provincial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clownish</hi>, etc. (in this sense not freq. till after the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">previously, as in Cic., agrestis was more used): rustica vox et agrestis quosdam delectat, etc. ... neque solum rusticam asperitatem, sed etiam peregrinam insolentiam fugere discamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bardā et pro rusticā haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus inlitteratusque litigator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (with indoctae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with indoctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with barbarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. disertus) 7, 1, 43: id vitium sermonis non barbarum esse, sed rusticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germana illuvies, rusticus, hircus, hara suis, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a lout</tr>, <tr>clown</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticus es, Corydon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid coeptum, rustice, rumpis iter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addidit obscenis convicia rustica dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 522</bibl></cit>: sive procax aliqua est; <cit><quote lang="la">capior, quia rustica non est,</quote> <trans><tr>very prudish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 607</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen est, quamvis agros amet illa feraces, Rustica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:72:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 72, 11</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simus hoc titulo rusticiore contenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ru-stĭcē</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">in a countrified manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clownishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boorishly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquinon aspere, non vaste, non rustice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo vitio loquentes rustice loqui dictitabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusticius toga defluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
rusum: <entryFree id="n42082" type="main" key="ru_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūsum</orth>, v. rursus.</entryFree>
ruta: <entryFree id="n42083" type="main" key="ru^ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭta caesa</orth>, v. <itype>ruo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42084" type="greek" key="ru_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">r(uth/</foreign> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 103</bibl> Müll.), <sense id="n42084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bitter herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:5" default="NO">12, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:131" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 13, 51, § 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 801</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:52:8" default="NO">52, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42084.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="RUTU" /> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasantness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras exspecto Leptam, ad cujus rutam pulegio mihi tui sermonis utendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rutabulum: <entryFree id="n42085" type="main" key="ru^ta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ruo</etym>, <sense id="n42085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for raking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stirring up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42085.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42085.2" n="A" level="2"> For fire, <hi rend="ital">a fire-shovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oven-rake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 5</bibl>; Novat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 226 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42085.3" n="B" level="2"> For cookery, <hi rend="ital">a wooden shovel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spattle</hi> for stirring and mixing liquids, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:2" default="NO">12, 23, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42085.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = membrum virile, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 24 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
rutaceus: <entryFree id="n42086" type="hapax" key="ru_ta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūtācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. ruta</etym>, <sense id="n42086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of rue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made from rue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rutatus: <entryFree id="n42087" type="main" key="ru_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flavored</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garnished with rue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rutellum: <entryFree id="n42088" type="hapax" key="ru_tellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūtellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>rutrum</etym>, <sense id="n42088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little shovel</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ruteni: <entryFree id="n42089" type="main" key="Ru^te_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtēni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Rŭth-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of the Cadurci</hi>, dwelling partly in the province now called <hi rend="ital">Rhodez</hi>, Départ. Aveyron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 402</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutilans: <entryFree id="n42090" type="main" key="ru^ti^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtĭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, v. rutilo <sense id="n42090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
rutilesco: <entryFree id="n42091" type="main" key="ru^ti^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtĭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n42091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [rutilus], <hi rend="ital">to grow reddish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutilianus: <entryFree id="n42092" type="main" key="Ru^ti^_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtĭ_lĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Rutilius.</entryFree>
rutilius: <entryFree id="n42093" type="main" key="Ru^ti^_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtĭ_lĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rutilus, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=264" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 264</bibl> and 265 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n42093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n42093.1" n="1" level="3"> P. Rutilius Rufus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 649, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jurist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29 sq.</bibl> Ellendt; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42093.2" n="2" level="3"> P. Rutilius Lupus, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician in the time of Augustus and Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO">9, 3, 89</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42093.3" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭ-tĭ_lĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Rutilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:35" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 35</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>, the correct reading is Rutilii narratione).</sense></entryFree>
rutilo: <entryFree id="n42094" type="main" key="ru^ti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. rutilus</etym>. <sense id="n42094.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">color reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 51, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n42094.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be reddish;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">to have a reddish glow</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): aurora, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 83</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:251" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilans color,</quote> <trans><tr>of a reddish glow</tr>, <tr>glowing redly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arva rutilantia sanguineo gyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:514" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 514</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: rutilantior auro, Ven. Carm. 8, 7, 351.</sense></entryFree>
rutilus: <entryFree id="n42095" type="main" key="ru^ti^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. rudhiras, red, bloody; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)ruqro/s</foreign>; Lat. ruber, rufus</etym>. <sense id="n42095.0" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">red</hi> (inclining to golden yellow): <cit><quote lang="la">aurei rutili et inde etiam mulieres valde rufae rutilae dictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:5:section=83" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 5, § 83</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=285" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 285</bibl> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Plaut. Rud. 5:2:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Plaut. Rud. 5, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Merc. 2:2:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the hair,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">635</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 440</bibl>; 6, 715 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">peculiar to the Germans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor rutilus horribilisque terris, quem Martium dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 454</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 403</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:294" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the golden fleece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:114" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes (Pactoli),</quote> <trans><tr>bearing gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilae canes, id est non procul a rubro colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=285" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 285</bibl></cit> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n42095.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glittering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thorax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:620" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 341</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42096" type="main" key="Ru^ti^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. rutilus</etym>, <sense id="n42096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. of the augur T. Virginius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutrum: <entryFree id="n42097" type="main" key="ru_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūtrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ruo, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=134" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 134</bibl> Müll.</etym>. <sense id="n42097.0" n="I" level="1"> An implement for digging, <hi rend="ital">a spade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shovel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; Varr. and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:843" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 843</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42097.1" n="II" level="1"> For mixing mortar, <hi rend="ital">a trowel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutuba: <entryFree id="n42098" type="main" key="ru^tu^ba1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtŭba</orth>, perturbatio: nunc sumus in rutubā, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 167, 9</bibl>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42099" type="main" key="Ru^tu^ba2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42099.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Roya</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 422</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42099.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a gladiator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutula: <entryFree id="n42100" type="gloss" key="ru_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rūtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. ruta</etym>, <sense id="n42100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little piece of rue</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 13, 47, 2</bibl>. <cb n="S" /></sense></entryFree>
rutuli: <entryFree id="n42101" type="main" key="Ru^tu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42101.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient people of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose capital was</hi> Ardea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 472</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">795</bibl> et saep. —In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Rutulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 409</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 474</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 65 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Rutulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex, i. e. Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 728</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 318</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 88: acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42101.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Saguntum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Ardea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:584" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 584</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:541" default="NO">2, 541</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:567 al" default="NO">567 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n42101.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., of <hi rend="ital">the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:450" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:165" default="NO">11, 165</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, of <hi rend="ital">a Roman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
rutupiae: <entryFree id="n42102" type="main" key="Ru^tu^pi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭpĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town and haven of the Cantii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Richborough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Kent.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Rŭtŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Rutupiœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
rutus: <entryFree id="n42103" type="main" key="ru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">rŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (ruta caesa), v. <itype>ruo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <cb n="S." /></entryFree>
s: <entryFree id="n42104" type="main" key="S"><orth extent="full" lang="la">S</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">s</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> or (agreeing with littera) <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42104.0" n="I" level="1"> The eighteenth letter of the Latin alphabet, corresponding in form to the old Greek S for <foreign lang="greek">*s</foreign> (Etruscan in a reversed form, <foreign />); <cit><quote lang="la">in its nature a sibilant semi-vowel, whose peculiarities were much discussed by the ancients, and are even treated of in a special work by Messala, a contemporary of Augustus (Messala in libro de S littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 245</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n42104.1" n="II" level="1"> As an initial and medial it has a hard and sharp sound (which is softened, however, between two vowels), and is therefore joined only with the tenues (c, p, t; cf., on the contrary, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sbe/nnumi</foreign>); <cit><quote lang="la">and, as a medial, often written double after long vowels: caussa, cassus, divissiones (these forms, used by Cicero and Vergil, were already uncommon in Quintilian's time,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 283 sq.).—</sense><sense id="n42104.2" n="III" level="1"> As a final it had a weakened sound, and therefore not only admitted the medial <hi rend="ital">b</hi> before it (plebs, urbs, abs; Arabs, chalybs, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">B</ref></xr>), but often entirely disappeared. So in the ante-class. poets down to the early years of Cicero (and also in his own poem, entitled Aratus, written in his youth), before words beginning with a consonant, to avoid position: Ratu' Romulus, Fulviu' Nobilior, gravi' Terra, est sati' bella, Hyperioni' cursum, Virgine' nam sibi, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 38</bibl>; and v. Freund, in Jahn's Neue Jahrb. 1835, XIII. p. 25 sq.; less freq. before words beginning with a vowel, in which case, to avoid a hiatus, the vowel before <hi rend="ital">s</hi> was also elided; vas' argenteis (for vasis argenteis) and palm' et crinibus (for palmis et crinibus); v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>. So, too, in the fourth Epitaph of the Scipios (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 553</bibl>), L. CORNELIO L. F. instead of CORNELIOS (cf. a similar elision of the M under that letter). Final <hi rend="ital">s</hi> is also elided, and the preceding vowel either dropped with it or weakened, in the forms sat from satis, mage from magis; in the neutr. forms of adjectives of the third declension, acre, agreste, facile (v. the letter E); in the collat. forms of the sec. pers. sing. pass., fatere, fateare, fatebare, etc.; in the gen. sing. of the first, second, and fifth declensions, and in the nom. plur. of the first and second declensions (aurai for aura-is, analog. to reg<hi rend="ital">is</hi>, etc.). Lastly, <hi rend="ital">s</hi> disappears in the (mostly familiar) collat. forms abin', scin', viden', satin', from abisne, scisne, videsne, satisne, etc.—</sense><sense id="n42104.3" n="IV" level="1"> As an etymological initial aspirate, <hi rend="ital">s</hi> appears in many words whose Greek equivalents begin with a vowel: sal, semi-, serpo, sex, super, sus, corresp. to <foreign lang="greek">a(/ls, h(mi-, e(/rpw, e(/c, u(pe/r, u/=s,</foreign> etc.; si (archaic sei), sero, Segesta, corresp. to <foreign lang="greek">ei), *)e*r*w</foreign> (whence <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rw</foreign>), <foreign lang="greek">*)/egesta.</foreign> Less freq. in radical words beginning with a consonant: sculpo corresp. to <foreign lang="greek">glu/fw,</foreign> and the derivatives scruta, from <foreign lang="greek">gru/th,</foreign> and scrupedae, from <foreign lang="greek">krou/peza.</foreign> To soften the termination, <hi rend="ital">s</hi> appears in abs = ab, and ex corresp. to <foreign lang="greek">e)k.</foreign>—Very freq., on the contrary, an initial <hi rend="ital">s</hi> appears in cognate forms in other languages, where corresp. Latin words have lost the <hi rend="ital">s</hi>: Lat. fallo, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfa/llw</foreign>; fungus, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfo/ggos</foreign>; fides, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfi/dh</foreign> (comp. also nix with Engl. <pb n="1609" /> <cb n="SABA" /> snow, nurus with old Germ. snur, daughterin-law); cf. also cutis and scutum; cauda and root sku-, in Goth. skauts, etc.; casa and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skia/, skhnh/</foreign>; cerno and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kri/nw</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">ski/rnw, skw/r, skwri/a</foreign>; calumnia and <foreign lang="greek">ska/llw</foreign>; gradior and root scra-, Germ. schreiten; parco and <foreign lang="greek">sparno/s</foreign>; penuria and <foreign lang="greek">spa/nis</foreign>; pando and <foreign lang="greek">spa/w</foreign>; tego and <foreign lang="greek">ste/gw</foreign>; tono and <foreign lang="greek">sto/nos</foreign>; taurus and Sanscr. sthūras, Germ. Stier al.; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 277 sqq.—In the middle of a word <hi rend="ital">s</hi> is dropped in at from ast.—</sense><sense id="n42104.4" n="V" level="1"> S is interchanged, </sense><sense id="n42104.5" n="A" level="2"> Most freq. with <hi rend="ital">r;</hi> in partic., an original <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, between two vowels, becomes <hi rend="ital">r;</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 26</bibl> Müll.; so foederum for foedesum, plurima for plusima, meliorem for meliosem, Lares for Lases, etc.; cf. eram and sum, quaero and quaeso, nasus and naris. Appius Claudius, the censor, is said to have introduced <hi rend="ital">r</hi> into the names Furius, Valerius, etc., in place of <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, B.C. 312 (v. the letter R, II.).—</sense><sense id="n42104.6" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">d</hi>: Claudius, from the Sabine Clausus; and, on the other hand, rosa, corresp. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(o/don</foreign>; cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Gram. 1, p. 259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 1, p. 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42104.7" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">t</hi>: tensus and tentus, resina corresp. to <foreign lang="greek">r(hti/nh</foreign>; and, on the contrary, aggrettus for aggressus; mertare, pultare, for mersare, pulsare (perh. also assentor for assensor).—</sense><sense id="n42104.8" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">x;</hi> v. that letter.—</sense><sense id="n42104.9" n="VI" level="1"> S is assimilated before <hi rend="ital">f</hi> in the compounds of dis: differo, difficilis, diffluo, etc.; v. 3. dis.— On the other hand, it arises by assimilation from <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, in assum, assumo, cessi, for adsum, adsumo, ced-si; from <hi rend="ital">t</hi> in fassus, from fateor; from <hi rend="ital">b</hi> in jussi, from jubeo; from <hi rend="ital">m</hi> in pressi, from premo; from <hi rend="ital">r</hi> in gessi, from gero; and dossuarius, from dorsum. —</sense><sense id="n42104.10" n="VII" level="1"> As an abbreviation, S denotes sacrum, semis, sibi, suis, etc.; S. AS. D., sub asciā dedicavit; S. C., senatusconsultum; perh. also, sententia collegii (<bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2385</bibl>); S. P., sua pecunia; S. P. Q. R., Senatus Populusque Romanus, etc.</sense></entryFree>
saba: <entryFree id="n42105" type="main" key="Sa^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/ba.</foreign> <sense id="n42105.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The largest town in Arabia Felix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially celebrated for its myrrh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankincense</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">turifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 52</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42105.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să-baeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sabai=os,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Sabœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor, Col. poët. 10, 262: nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 376" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 376</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">flos, i. e. of myrrh,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:709" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 480</bibl></cit>: cumulus, <hi rend="ital">a funeral pyre</hi> perfumed with myrrh, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phoen. 43</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">the territory of Saba</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 3</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a numerous people in Arabia Felix</hi> (named after their capital city, Saba), <hi rend="ital">the Sabœans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaei Arabum propter tura clarissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 154</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 706</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:23" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabadius: <entryFree id="n42106" type="main" key="Sa^ba_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbādĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Sabazius.</entryFree>
sabaia: <entryFree id="n42107" type="main" key="sabaia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabaia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drink of the poor people in Illyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepared from barley</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabaiarius: <entryFree id="n42108" type="main" key="sabaia_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabaiārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sabaia</etym>, <sense id="n42108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sells</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drinks</hi> sabaia, a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">et injuriose compellabatur ut sabaiarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabanum: <entryFree id="n42109" type="greek" key="saba^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/banon</foreign> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 26, 7</bibl>), <sense id="n42109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen cloth</hi> for wiping, wrapping up in, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a towel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">napkin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 46, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sabaoth: <entryFree id="n42110" type="greek" key="Sa^ba^_oth"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbă_oth</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sabaw/q</foreign> [Heb. <foreign />], <sense id="n42110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heavenly hosts</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 901</bibl>: Dominus or Deus Sabaoth, <hi rend="ital">the Lord</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">God</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of hosts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabaria: <entryFree id="n42111" type="main" key="Sa^ba_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbārĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Săvā-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Pannonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the emperor Claudius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence called Sabaria Claudia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Szombathely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colonia divi Claudii Sabaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 27, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabatenum: <entryFree id="n42112" type="main" key="sabate_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabatēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = diabathrum, <sense id="n42112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of slipper</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabatini: <entryFree id="n42113" type="main" key="Sabati_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sabatīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of a town in Campania</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sabatinus: <entryFree id="n42114" type="main" key="Sa_ba_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sābātīnus</orth> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sābātĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sabate</hi> (a town of Etruria): lacus, <hi rend="ital">the Lake of Sabate</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Bracciano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 71" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called lacus Sabate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl></cit> <cb n="SABI" /> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabatina tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. l. l.—Form Sabatius: stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:492" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 492</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabazius: <entryFree id="n42115" type="greek" key="Sa^ba_zi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbāzĭus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕbāzĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sĕbādĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbādĭus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*saba/zios,</foreign> <sense id="n42115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42115.1" n="I" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 101</bibl>; Macr. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbā-zĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival in honor of Sabazius</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 170</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2357</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42115.2" n="II" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabazii Jovis cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabbatarius: <entryFree id="n42116" type="main" key="sabba^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabbătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sabbata</etym>, <sense id="n42116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Sabbath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sabbatical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sabbă-tārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Sabbath-keepers</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Jews</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabbatismus: <entryFree id="n42117" type="greek" key="sabba^tismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabbătismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sabbatismo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeping of the Sabbath</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 140, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Isa. 16, 58, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabbatizo: <entryFree id="n42118" type="greek" key="sabba^ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabbătīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sabbati/zw,</foreign> <sense id="n42118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to observe the Sabbath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ephes. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lev. 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabbatum: <entryFree id="n42119" type="main" key="sabba^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabbătum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and, more freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">sab-băta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/bbata</foreign> (orig. Heb. <foreign />). <sense id="n42119.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42119.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the day of rest</hi> among the Jews, <hi rend="ital">the Sabbath;</hi> considered by the Romans to have been ordained as a fast-day. <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 14</bibl>; August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 18, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 12, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42119.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a name for the seventh day of the week, <hi rend="ital">Saturday</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.—Sing.</hi> form, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 121, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 9, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42119.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other Jewish holidays, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:184" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 159</bibl>: tricesima, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the new moon</hi> (said <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a Jewish holiday</hi> in general), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 69</bibl>; cf. Orell. and Wüstem. ad Heind. ad h. 1.</sense></entryFree>
sabelli: <entryFree id="n42120" type="main" key="Sa^belli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbelli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. contr. from Sabinuli, from Sabini</etym>, the more ancient and, for the most part, poetical name for <sense id="n42120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Sabines</hi>, Varr. ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 167</bibl>: duri, Col. poët. 10, 137; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 36</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: renuit negitatque Sabellus, <hi rend="ital">the Sabellian</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">Horace</hi>, as the owner of an estate in the Sabine territory), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 49</bibl> Schol. Crucq. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:687" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 687</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n42120.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Sabellians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sabellian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:169" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an old hag</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:221" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42120.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbellĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sabellian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus caulium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabellius: <entryFree id="n42121" type="main" key="Sa^belli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbellĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an elder of the Christian Church at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards at Ptolemais</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the third century</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of the heretical sect of Sabellians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 178</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbellĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Sabellius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sabellians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fid. 5, 13, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Incarn. Sacr. 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabina: <entryFree id="n42122" type="main" key="Sa^bi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sabini, B. 2.</entryFree>
sabine: <entryFree id="n42123" type="main" key="Sa^bi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Sabini, A. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign></entryFree>
sabini: <entryFree id="n42124" type="main" key="Sa^bi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ancient Italian people adjoining the Latins</hi>, a part of whom, as early as the time of Romulus, were united with the Romans as one people, under the name of Quirites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 638</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 32</bibl> Müll.; Col. praef. § 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 2, 16</bibl> sq.; 3, 26 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 797</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 25</bibl> et saep. —<usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (cf.: Bruttii, Lucani, and v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 32</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">the Sabine territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Sabinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42124.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:1:6" default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:118 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 118 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L.
