L. 6, § 57</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines raptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6:3:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9 sq.</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § 107 ib.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">origo (vocabuli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, § 28 ib.: ficus, Varr. R. <cb n="SACA" /> R. 1, 67: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n42124.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Sabine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the Sabine tongue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=159" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 159</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42124.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: Sabina herba, <hi rend="ital">a kind of juniper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the savin</hi>: Juniperus Sabina, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">used for incense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 70, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 20, 33, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:98" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 13, 21, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 61, § 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:343" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 741</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42124.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42124.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Sabine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 26</bibl>.—And as <hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, </sense><sense id="n42124.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A servant of Trebonius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42124.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an Augustan poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Ovid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 27</bibl>; the same perh. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42124.8" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The surname of the jurist</hi> Massurius, v. h. v.— </sense><sense id="n42124.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of the emperor Vespasian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Sabinus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri Sabiniani, the books composed by him,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 33, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34, 14 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīnĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Sabinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sabinists</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:11" default="NO">41, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42124.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Sabine woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO">2, 32</bibl> (3, 30), 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 102</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42124.11" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săbī-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42124.12" n="a" level="4"> (Sc. vinum.) <hi rend="ital">Sabine wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42124.13" n="b" level="4"> (Sc. praedium.) <hi rend="ital">The estate of Horace in the territory of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of Tibur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">described by the poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 1</bibl>-14; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:596" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 596</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number> (sc. praedia): <cit><quote lang="la">satis beatus unicis Sabinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabis: <entryFree id="n42125" type="main" key="Sabis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sabis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42125.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Gallia Belgica</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Sambre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42125.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Carmania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 27, § 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42125.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A deity of the Sabœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sablo: <entryFree id="n42126" type="main" key="sablo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sablo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sablum</orth>, v. sabulo.</entryFree>
sabota: <entryFree id="n42127" type="main" key="Sabota"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sabota</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:52 al" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 13, 30, § 52 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sabrata: <entryFree id="n42128" type="main" key="Sa_bra^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sābrăta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sābrătha</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Lesser Syrtis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sabart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sābrătensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sabrata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Conc. Carth. p. 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabrina: <entryFree id="n42129" type="main" key="Sabri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sabrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Severn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabucus: <entryFree id="n42130" type="main" key="sabu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sabūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sambucus.</entryFree>
sabuleta: <entryFree id="n42131" type="hapax" key="sa^bu^le_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săbŭlēta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sabulum</etym>, <sense id="n42131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sandy places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 41, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sabulo: <entryFree id="n42132" type="main" key="sa^bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săbŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">săbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:48" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 28, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 27</bibl>), <sense id="n42132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coarse sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravel</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">harena, glarea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:1" default="NO">4, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 8, 2</bibl>.—Sync.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_blo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_blum</orth>, Ven. Fort. 9, 15, 5.</sense></entryFree>
sabulosus: <entryFree id="n42133" type="main" key="sa^bu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săbŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sabulo</etym>, <sense id="n42133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sandy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravelly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sabulum: <entryFree id="n42134" type="main" key="sa^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sabulo.</entryFree>
saburra: <entryFree id="n42135" type="main" key="sa^burra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săburra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with sabulo</etym>, <sense id="n42135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sand</hi>, esp. in ships as ballast: <cit><quote lang="la">onerarias multā saburrā gravatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctu jactante saburram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:60" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 23, 30, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42136" type="main" key="Sa^burra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săburra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sabbŭra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lieutenant of King Juba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 95:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 95, 1</bibl>.—Form Sabbŭra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:441" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 723</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saburralis: <entryFree id="n42137" type="hapax" key="sa^burra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săburrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saburra</etym>, <sense id="n42137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of sand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sand-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacoma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
saburrarius: <entryFree id="n42138" type="gloss" key="sa^burra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săburrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who carries ballast to ships</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORPVS SABVRRARIORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saburro: <entryFree id="n42139" type="main" key="sa^burro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săburro</orth>, no <sense id="n42139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lade with ballast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ballast</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n42139.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese harenā (echini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 361</bibl></cit>.—Mid., <hi rend="ital">to ballast one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grues sublatis lapillis ad moderatam gravitatem saburrantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42139.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ubi saburratae sumus, <hi rend="ital">we are stuffed full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crammed full</hi>, comic. for saturatae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, perh. sanguis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a drunken person</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sabus: <entryFree id="n42140" type="main" key="Sabus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sabus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42140.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 8, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42140.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The progenitor and god of the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:423" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacae: <entryFree id="n42141" type="main" key="Sa^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săcae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Săgae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/kai,</foreign> <sense id="n42141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Northern Asia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a part of the Scythians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:6" default="NO">7, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 6</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săces</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">*sa/khs</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 157</bibl>. <pb n="1610" /> <cb n="SACE" /></sense></entryFree>
sacal: <entryFree id="n42142" type="foreign" key="sacal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacal</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Egyptian</etym>, <sense id="n42142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Egyptian amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccarius: <entryFree id="n42143" type="main" key="sacca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saccus</etym>, <sense id="n42143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sacks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sack-</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n42143.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: navis, perh. <hi rend="ital">laden with sacks</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42143.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42143.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sac-cārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who carries sacks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:40:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 40, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4176</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42143.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sac-cārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the labor of a porter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (al. sagariam).</sense></entryFree>
saccatum: <entryFree id="n42144" type="main" key="sacca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sacco, II.</etym>, <sense id="n42144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">urine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccellatio: <entryFree id="n42145" type="main" key="saccella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saccellus</etym>; <sense id="n42145.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in the later medic. lang.,</quote> <trans><tr>the applying of a little bag</tr>, <tr>a dry poultice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccellus: <entryFree id="n42146" type="main" key="saccellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>saccus</etym>, <sense id="n42146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bag</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonantes aere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidi,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>dry poultices for the sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,038:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mich. 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacceus: <entryFree id="n42147" type="main" key="sacce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sack-</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cingulum, tunica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of coarse sackcloth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Hilar. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccharon: <entryFree id="n42148" type="greek" key="saccha^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacchăron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/kxaron,</foreign> <sense id="n42148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweet juice distilling from the joints of the bamboo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sugar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 8, 17, § 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccibuccis: <entryFree id="n42149" type="hapax" key="sacci^buccis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccĭbuccis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saccus-bucca</etym>, <sense id="n42149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chubby-cheeked</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccinus: <entryFree id="n42150" type="main" key="sacci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>saccus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n42150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of hair-cloth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacciperium: <entryFree id="n42151" type="main" key="sacci^pe_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccĭpērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>saccus-pera</etym>, <sense id="n42151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pocket for carrying a purse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacco: <entryFree id="n42152" type="main" key="sacco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacco</orth>, no <sense id="n42152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>saccus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to strain through a bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42152.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccata aqua (opp. turbida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 17, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:104 al" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 34, § 104 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecuba,</quote> <trans><tr>to filter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:40:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 40, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42152.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of urine: <cit><quote lang="la">saccatus umor corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1028" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1028</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 6, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saccularius: <entryFree id="n42153" type="main" key="saccu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sacculus</etym>, one who by juggling tricks, etc., steals money from the pocket; <sense id="n42153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cut-purse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pick-pocket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swindler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1" default="NO">18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Tog. Cand. p. 90" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Tog. Cand. p. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacculus: <entryFree id="n42154" type="main" key="saccu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>saccus</etym>, <sense id="n42154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sack</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bag</hi> (not in Cic.); for filtering wine, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for grain,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. for money,</quote> <trans><tr>a purse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno cum turget sacculus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:27" default="NO">11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:3:6" default="NO">11, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:1:section=36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 1, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 20</bibl>.—Hence, comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacculus Plenus aranearum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saccus: <entryFree id="n42155" type="greek" key="saccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/kkos,</foreign> <sense id="n42155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bag.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42155.1" n="I" level="1"> Cum iste civitatibus frumentum, coria, cilicia, saccos imperaret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulus ferebat) tumentes multo saccos hordeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a moneybag</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam poni jubet atque Effundi saccos nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 6</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a bag</hi> for straining, filtering wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:60:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 60, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 19, § 53</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vinarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivarius, for straining snow-water,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:104" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 104</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> for purifying fat: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps saccatus lineis saccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 134</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for laying on a diseased part of the body: nervorum dolores, in saccis aquā ferventi crebro candefactus levat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 44, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 57, 2</bibl> et saep. —Of <hi rend="ital">a beggar</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wallet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scrip;</hi> prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saccum ire,</quote> <trans><tr>to go beg</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42155.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (eccl. Lat.; like the Heb. <foreign />), <hi rend="ital">a garment of sackcloth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hair-cloth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 3, 31</bibl>; id. Joel, 1, 8; id. Jona, 3, 5 et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Narrat. in Psa. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Narrat. in Psa. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 35, 451</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacellum: <entryFree id="n42156" type="main" key="sa^cellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sacrum</etym>, <sense id="n42156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sanctuary</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a small uncovered place consecrated to a divinity; a chapel</hi>: sacellum est locus parvus deo sacratus cum āra, Trebatius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacella dicuntur loca diis sacrata sine tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=318" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 318</bibl></cit>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=319" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 319</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt loca publica urbis, sunt sacella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaugurare fana sacellaque statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeciliam Metelli exisse in quoddam sacellum ominis capiendi causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quo—sed faciles Nymphae risere—sacello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 9</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium muros ex sacellis sepulchrisque constitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: flore sacella <cb n="SACE" /> tego, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 57: <cit><quote lang="la">incultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: Quirini, Fest. s. v. Quirinalis porta, p. 254 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naeniae deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=163" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 163</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:275" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:232" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacer: <entryFree id="n42157" type="main" key="sa^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcer</orth>, <itype>să_cra, să_crum</itype> (ante-class. collat. form sacer, sacris, sacre; <number>plur.</number>: <sense id="n42157.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sacres porci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:4:16" default="NO">4, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">sing. acc.</hi>: sacrem porcum, Fest. s. h. v. p. 318 Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root sa-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/os, sw=os,</foreign> safe; whence Lat. sānus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">dedicated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consecrated to a divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">i(ero/s</foreign> (cf.: sanctus, augustus): Gallus Aelius ait, sacrum esse quocumque modo atque instituto civitatis consecratum sit, sive aedis, sive ara, sive signum, sive locus, sive pecunia, sive quid aliud quod dis dedicatum atque consecratum sit, Fest. s. v. sacer mons, p. 318 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid destinatum est diis, sacrum vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae (res) sunt quae diis superis consecratae sunt: religiosae quae diis manibus relictae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 3</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n42157.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n42157.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam (opp. profanum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiis omnibus, publicis privatis sacris profanis, sic pepercit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54, § 129</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locus sacer et profanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscebis sacra profanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">villae signis et tabulis refertae partim publicis partim etiam sacris et religiosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; so (with religiosus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores autem rapere properant quā sacrum quā puplicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(legum) genera sunt tria, sacri, publici, privati juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecor hoc unum per jura sacerrima lecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 315</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus late sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia (opp. privata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis (of the sacrificial victim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales (so called from its use in augury),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luces (with profestae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dies (with religiosus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissum,</quote> <trans><tr>a crime against religion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: vitis (as sacred to Bacchus), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 149 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 464</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">focus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:43" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:501" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 501</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">montes (the Alps, because not to be ascended by men),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 70</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vates (because dedicated to Apollo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:113" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 113</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer interpresque deorum Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 391</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and (for sanctus) of the divinity itself: Vesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit> (4, 3), 11; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cybebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 22, 3 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl>: ut sacrosancti habeantur, quibus ipsi dii neque sacri neque sancti sunt, so used only on account of the lusus verbb. with sacrosancti; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the context).—Sacer Mons,</quote> <trans><tr>a hill about three miles from Rome</tr>, <tr>beyond the Anio</tr>, <tr>and on the right of the Via Nomentana</tr>, <tr>to which the Roman people retired during their controversy with the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os sacrum, quod imum ventrem sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: Sacra Via, or (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) Sacer Clivus, <hi rend="ital">a street in Rome leading from the Forum to the Capitol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:70:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 70, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also via, I. A. 2.: sacer morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the epilepsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacer lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a stone landmark</tr>, <tr>a mere-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13</bibl></cit>: os sacrum, anatom. t. t., = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(ero\n o)ste/on,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the lowest bone of the spine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:24" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae sacrae (eccl. Lat.),</quote> <trans><tr>the Scriptures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—For its combinations with ignis, via, etc., v. those words.—</sense><sense id="n42157.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego te sacram coronam surripuisse scio Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urna Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">urna Veneria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae celebris dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum Batti veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 31, § 76</bibl>.—As a predicate: terra, ut focus domiciliorum, sacra deorum omnium est (a transl. of the Platon. <foreign lang="greek">*gh= i(era\ pa/ntwn qew=n</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2</bibl>, <cb n="SACE" /> 18, 45: <cit><quote lang="la">illa insula (sc. Delos) eorum deorum sacra putatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42157.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, II. A.): sacra Jovi quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esculus Jovi sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 4, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphis cervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereri Polyphoetes (as a priest),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugionem templo Salutis detraxerat gestabatque velut magno operi sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus Diti sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aesculus Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 4, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.—As a predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">Jani mensis, Qui sacer est imis Manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 52</bibl></cit>, quercus antiqua, quae erat Marti sacra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl> (al. sacrata).—</sense><sense id="n42157.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (not till after the Aug. per., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit> (4, 15), 11: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua (Ciceronis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:69:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 69, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>. 56, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam patris memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O sacer et magnus vatum labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:983" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 983</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu sacri vatum errores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:100" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 100</bibl></cit>.—So used of the emperors; <cit><quote lang="la">disapproved of by Tiberius: (Tiberius) alium dicentem sacras ejus occupationes verba mutare et pro sacris laboriosas dicere coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl></cit>.—But soon after Tiberius in general use: <cit><quote lang="la">auris Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:99:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 99, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri lateris custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:76:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aures sacras mentitus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 26</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se Imperatori mentitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 26, § 21</bibl></cit>); and hence, for <hi rend="ital">ecclesiastical</hi>: domus, comitatus, scrinia, largitiones, etc., in the law books et saep.</sense><sense id="n42157.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with a bad accessory signif., <hi rend="ital">devoted to a divinity for destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forfeited;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42157.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: si quisquam aliuta faxit, ipsos Jovi sacer esto, Lex Numae ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 6</bibl> Müll.; cf.: ut caput ejus Jovi sacrum esset, an ancient plebiscitum ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alienum videtur, de condicione eorum hominum referre, quos leges sacros esse certis diis jubent, quod, cum cetera sacra violari nefas sit, hominem sacrum jus fuerit occidi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42157.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: homo sacer is est, quem populus judicavit ob maleficium; neque fas est eum immolari; sed qui occidit, parricidii non damnatur. Nam lege tribuniciā primā cavetur: si quis eum, qui eo plebei scito sacer sit, occiderit, parricida ne sit. Ex quo quivis homo malus atque improbus sacer appellari solet, Fest. s. v. sacer mons, p. 318 Müll.: PATRONVS SI CLIENTI FRAVDEM FECERIT SACER ESTO, LEX XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 609</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in imitation: uter aedilis fuerit, etc. ... is intestabilis et sacer esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum, qui cuiquam nocuerit, sacrum sanciri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42157.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n42157.10" n="a" level="4"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum malus, Ego sum sacer, scelestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 22</bibl> (with malus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 397:27" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 397, 27</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sacerrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 69</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 29</bibl> (with pessimus). —</sense><sense id="n42157.11" n="b" level="4"> Of things: sacerrimum domicilium, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di magni, horribilem et sacrum libellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hircus alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:71:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 71, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 57</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum (Medeae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:165" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:798" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:804" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>epilepsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut immerentis fluxit in terram Remi Sacer nepotibus cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not appear (as for the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 77</bibl> Müll.).—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something consecrated; a holy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacred vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utensil; a sanctuary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a temple; a religious act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi>, etc.; in <number>plur.</number> in gen., <hi rend="ital">sacred rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religious worship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">religion</hi> (both of the State and of single races and families; and even of individuals; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, <foreign lang="greek">b;</foreign> class.; most freq. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n42157.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42157.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum sacrove commendatum qui cleperit rapsitque parricida esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sacro manus sis admolitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne sacrum rapiente dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuens velut contingere sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Cluacinae sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 5, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum veluti quoddam illius sacri templum vocabimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <pb n="1611" /> <cb n="SACE" /> quae (sacerdos Cereris) Graecum illud sacrum monstraret et faceret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum Herculi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere Junoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">facto per Magos sacro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne sacrum conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita se habet sacrum (Suovetaurilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma lecta conici in acervum jussit consul sacrumque id Vulcano cremavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum piaculare fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne Apollinis sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyrā sacri sub imagine factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec de lucernā fas est accendi sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve initianto, nisi ut assolet, Cereri, Graeco sacro,</quote> <trans><tr>according to the Grecian rites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetabo, qui Cereris sacrum Vulgarit arcanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morientibus operire (oculos) rursusque in rogo patefacere, Quiritium ritu sacrum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sacro est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42157.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: sacra deosque penates .. ex aedibus suis eripuisse dixit, <hi rend="ital">sacred vessels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utensils</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy things</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra omnia proferre, Auct. B. Alex. 32, 3: portabant canistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troïa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut qui Junonis sacra ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 717</bibl> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque suis penetralia sacris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the images of the gods</tr>, <tr>Penates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactata aequoribus sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C.4,4,54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri Sacra canunt,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred songs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra ordine in mensā Penatium deorum Ponuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred gifts</tr>, <tr>offerings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve ulla vitiorum sacra sollemnia obeunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in sollemnibus sacris fieri consuevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Mercurius) sacris anniversariis coleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39, § 84</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificiis anniversariis colebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 57</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">128: sacris e principum numero pontifices quinque praefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) sacra diis aliis Albano ritu, Graeco Herculi facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Jovi facturus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Jovi Stygio Perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (Numa) plurima sacra obibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densi circumstant sacra ministri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:454" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mystica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:140" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:382" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 370</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n42157.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Divine worship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">religion</hi> in gen.: publica sacra, quae publico sumptu pro populo fiunt, quaeque pro montibus, pagis, curiis, sacellis: at privata, quae pro singulis hominibus, familiis, gentibus fiunt, Fest. pp. 244 and 245 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo foedere (Romulus) et Sabinos in civitatem ascivit, sacris communicatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod per populum errari fas non erat propter religionem sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">religio sacrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Cereris conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orphica,</quote> <trans><tr>rites</tr>, <tr>solemnity</tr>, <tr>festival</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trieterica Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:587" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 489: Isidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42157.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The private religious rites</hi> of a gens, a family, etc. (observed by the Romans with the greatest care): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra privata perpetua manento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an gentilicia sacra ne in bello quidem intermitti, publica sacra et Romanos deos etiam in pace deseri placet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne morte patris familias sacrorum memoria occideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docebant (antiqui) tribus modis sacris adstringi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum est eadem habere monumenta majorum, eisdem uti sacris, sepulcra habere communia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui natus sit, ignoret, cujus sanguinis, quorum sacrorum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4,2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra interire illi (majores) noluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum alienatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 144</bibl></cit> (v. alienatio); cf. <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum familiare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptialia,</quote> <trans><tr>marriage solemnities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also jugalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 700</bibl></cit>; cf. respecting the sacra privata of the Romans, Savigny, in his Zeitschr. 2, p. 397 sq.—</sense><sense id="n42157.17" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">poems</hi> (as sacred to the Muses): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi jam puero caelestia sacra placebant, Inque suum furtim Musa trahebat opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 7" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:63:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 63, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42157.18" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n42157.19" n="a" level="4"> Inter sacrum saxumque <cb n="SACE" /> stare, <hi rend="ital">to stand between the victim and the knife</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be between the door and the wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in great straits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 84</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sacrum et saxum positus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42157.20" n="b" level="4"> Hereditas sine sacris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a great profit without trouble</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">a rose without thorns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meat without bone</hi>, etc. (because the keeping up of the sacra privata was attended with great expense), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 8</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 83</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42157.21" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (the figure being borrowed from secret religious rites), in <number>plur.</number>: sacra, <hi rend="ital">secrets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mysteries</hi> (not till after the Aug. period, and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra tori coitusque novos referebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregisse mihi videor sacra tradentium artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fere, qui legem dicendi, quasi quaedam mysteria, tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 60</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum profanare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacerdos: <entryFree id="n42158" type="main" key="sa^cerdos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<sense id="n42158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> collat. form SACERDOTA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2184</bibl>; cf. antistes <hi rend="ital">init.; gen. plur.</hi> SACERDOTIVM, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1942</bibl>) [sacer], <hi rend="ital">a priest; a priestess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divis aliis alii sacerdotes, omnibus pontifices, singulis flamines sunto. . . sacerdotum duo genera sunto: unum quod praesit caerimoniis et sacris, alterum quod interpretetur fatidicorum et vatum effata incognita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in collegio sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes casti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae Ephesiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximus (Syracusanorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2,2,52, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumuloque sacerdos additur Anchiseo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 760</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Cereris per Graecas semper curata sunt sacerdotes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Veneria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; 2, 3, 20; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 30: hujus fani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestae,</quote> <trans><tr>a Vestal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 573</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 47</bibl> (37): Vestalis, an old formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troïa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ilia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the inscriptions in Orell. 2160 sq.—In apposition: proximi nobilissimis ac sacerdotibus viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illo adultero sacerdote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotem anum praecipem Reppulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">regina (i. e. Rhea Silvia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 273</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, sarcastically: <cit><quote lang="la">ille popularis, i. e. Clodius (on account of his smuggling himself in among the priestesses of the Bona Dea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the same: stuprorum sacerdos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyranni sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 110</bibl></cit>.—In eccl. Lat., of Christ as <hi rend="ital">a mediator</hi> between God and men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
