<entryFree id="n42159" type="main" key="Sa^cerdos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săcerdos</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. sacerdos</etym>, <sense id="n42159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of frequent occurrence</hi>, esp. in the gens Licinia: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Sacerdos,</quote> <trans><tr>a prœtor in Sicily before Verres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacerdotalis: <entryFree id="n42160" type="main" key="sa^cerdo_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdōtālis</orth> (collat. form SACERDOTIALIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2469</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to priests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacerdotal</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n42160.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <trans><tr>given by the priests on entering upon their office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>used by priests</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <trans><tr>an episcopal see</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of priestly rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 124, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4981</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42160.2" n="2" level="3"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdōtālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has filled a priestly office</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 5, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacerdotialis: <entryFree id="n42161" type="main" key="sa^cerdo_ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdōtĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. sacerdotalis <sense id="n42161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacerdotium: <entryFree id="n42162" type="main" key="sa^cerdo_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdōtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. sacerdos</etym>, <sense id="n42162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the priesthood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of priests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sacerdotal office</hi> (good prose; used equally in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>) </sense><sense id="n42162.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimum sacerdotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimi sacerdotii collegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter amplitudinem sacerdotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in sacerdotio diligentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem sacerdotio praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscum et religiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42162.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc idem de ceteris sacerdotiis Cn. Domitius tulit: quod populus per religionem sacerdotia mandare non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex de sacerdotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: de sacerdotiis contendere, <cb n="SACR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42162.3" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., of the mediatorial office of Christ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacerdotula: <entryFree id="n42163" type="main" key="sa^cerdo_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcerdōtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. sacerdos</etym>, <sense id="n42163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inferior priestess</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=130" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 130</bibl> Müll.; Veran. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. oletum, p. 203 Müll.; Fest. s. v. flaminia, p. 93 ib.</sense></entryFree>
sacersanctus: <entryFree id="n42164" type="spur" key="sa^cersanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcersanctus</orth>, a false read. for sacer sanctusque, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 13</bibl>).</entryFree>
saces: <entryFree id="n42165" type="main" key="Sa^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Sacae.</entryFree>
sacoma: <entryFree id="n42166" type="greek" key="sa_co_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sācōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sh/kwma,</foreign> <sense id="n42166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a counterpoise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weight precisely balancing something in the opposite scale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendet ex altera parte aequo pondere phelli sacoma saburrale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ad sacoma appendĕre, <hi rend="ital">precisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9</bibl>, praef. § 9.</sense></entryFree>
sacomarius: <entryFree id="n42167" type="main" key="sa_co_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sācōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacoma</etym>, <sense id="n42167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for a counterpoise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used for a weight in a balance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jon. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42167.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sācōmārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who makes counterpoises</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weights</hi> in gen.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also PONDERARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42167.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sācōmārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the public balance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weighing place</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacondios: <entryFree id="n42168" type="foreign" key="sacondios"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacondios</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">socondios</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n42168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hyacinth-colored amethyst</hi> in India, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>; v. sacos, or socos.</sense></entryFree>
sacopenium: <entryFree id="n42169" type="greek" key="sa^co^pe_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săcŏpēnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">saga/phnon,</foreign> <sense id="n42169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gum-like juice of an umbelliferous plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 52, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:197" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 18, 75, § 197</bibl>; called also, from the Greek, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sagapenon</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 56, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 3, 15, § 40</bibl> (Jahn, sacopenium in both passages).</sense></entryFree>
sacos: <entryFree id="n42170" type="foreign" key="sacos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">socos</orth> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n42170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hyacinthcolor</hi>, so called by the Indians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrabiliter: <entryFree id="n42171" type="main" key="sa^_cra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sacra; sc. passio</etym>, <sense id="n42171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like an epileptic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if in a fit of epilepsy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacramentalis: <entryFree id="n42172" type="main" key="sa^_cra_menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crāmentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacramentum</etym>, <sense id="n42172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sacramental</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Ps. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacramentum: <entryFree id="n42173" type="main" key="sa^_cra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sacro</etym>. <sense id="n42173.0" n="I" level="1"> In good class. Lat., a jurid. and milit. t. t. </sense><sense id="n42173.1" n="A" level="2"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the sum which the two parties to a suit at first deposited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but afterwards became bound for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with the</hi> tresviri capitales; so called because the sum deposited by the losing party was used for religious purposes, esp. for the sacra publica; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; or, perh. more correctly, because the money was deposited in a sacred place; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> passage of Varro and Müller's note. (Another reason is given in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 5, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: sacramentum est pignus sponsionis; vocatum autem sacramentum, quia violare, quod quisque promittit, perfidia est): ea pecunia, quae in judicium venit in litibus, sacramentum a sacro. Qui petebat et qui infitiabatur, de aliis rebus utrique quingenos aeris ad pontem deponebant, de aliis rebus item certo alio legitimo numero assum; <cit><quote lang="la">qui judicio vicerat, suom sacramentum e sacro auferebat, victi ad aerarium redibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=180" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 180</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: qui prior vindicaverat, dicebat: quando tu injuria vindicavisti, de aeris sacramento te provoco; adversarius quoque dicebat: similiter ego te; <cit><quote lang="la">seu L. asses sacramenti nominabant... Postea praedes Praetor ab utroque accipiebat sacramenti, quod id in publicum cedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl>, § 13 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">95: sacramenti autem nomine id aes dici coeptum est quod et propter aerarii inopiam et sacrorum publicorum multitudinem consumebatur id in rebus divinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl></cit> Müll.: cum in rem aliquam agerent litigatores et poena se sacramenti peterent, poscebant judicem, qui dabatur post trigesimum diem, Pseudo-Ascon. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl> (p. 164 Orell.): <cit><quote lang="la">de multae sacramento consules comitiis centuriatis tulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a civil suit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">process</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviri re quaesitā et deliberatā sacramentum nostrum justum judicaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">transf. in gen.: homines graves, quibuscum tibi justo sacramento contendere, non liceret,</quote> <trans><tr>on equal terms</tr>, <tr>with a fair chance of success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: cetera ... <foreign lang="greek">e)/ntexna</foreign> et arguta adparebunt, ut sacramento contendas mea non esse, <hi rend="ital">lay a wager</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">confidently assert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustis vindiciis ac sacramentis ali enos fundos petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: si Xviri <pb n="1612" /> <cb n="SACR" /> sacramentum in libertatem injustum judicassent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 29, 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> (cf. infra, 2, the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl>), orig. <hi rend="ital">the preliminary engagement</hi> entered into by newly-enlisted troops (this was followed by the proper military oath, jusjurandum, which was at first voluntary, but, after the second Punic war, was demanded by the military tribune): milites tum (i.e. 538 A.U.C.), quod numquam antea factum erat, jurejurando ab tribunis militum adacti milites [jussu consulis conventuros]: nam ad eam diem nihil praeter sacramentum fuerat; <cit><quote lang="la">et, ubi ad decuriatum aut centuriatum convenissent, suā voluntate ipsi inter sese decuriati equites, centuriati pedites conjurabant, sese fugae atque formidinis ergo non abituros neque ex ordine recessuros, nisi, etc.... Id ex voluntario inter ipsos foedere ad tribunos ac legitimam juris jurandi adactionem translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 2</bibl></cit> seq. Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; and v. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 292 sq.—Hence, since that time, </sense><sense id="n42173.4" n="2" level="3"> For jusjurandum, <hi rend="ital">the military oath of allegiance</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">milites Domitianos sacramentum apud se dicere jubet,</quote> <trans><tr>to take the oath of allegiance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 86</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos consulis sacramento rogavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; and in a like signif. in Livy: sacramento (<case>abl.</case>) dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5</bibl>; 41, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramento dicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>: ut omnes minores quinquaginta annis sacramento (<case>abl.</case>) rogaret, <hi rend="ital">should administer the oath of allegiance to them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swear them in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 26</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rogare (aliquos) sacramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in a like sense: adigere sacramento aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adigere aliquos sacramento Othonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adigere aliquos sacramento in nomen senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramento aliquem tenere ... sacramento tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">secundo eum obliget militiae sacramento, quia, priore amisso, jure cum hostibus pugnare non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit> (in which passage the primary jurid. signif. is alluded to): <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus (legionibus) aetate aut valetudine fessi sacramento solvebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionibus, quae sacramentum mutaverant, in paenitentiam conversis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had revolted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitentia mutati sacramenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus sacramentum exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sacramento (viz. in the service of Bacchus) initiatos juvenes milites faciendos censetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solemn obligation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut sacramento contendas mea non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego perfidum Dixi sacramentum: ibimus, ibimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verba Eumolpi sacramentum juravimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae sacramentum delevi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 80, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramento quodam nexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sacramento obstringere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 96</bibl></cit> (97), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod inesset mutis animalibus tacitum ac naturale sacramentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.6" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. and late Lat., <hi rend="ital">something to be kept sacred.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42173.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum regis abscondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The gospel revelation</hi>: nolite verba, cum sacramentum meum Erit canendum, providenter quaerere, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10,15.—</sense><sense id="n42173.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mystery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Tim. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 24</bibl>; Aug. de Agone Christi, 24.— </sense><sense id="n42173.10" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sacrament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa, cum ad res divinas pertinent, sacramenta appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 138" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baptismi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Doctr. Christ. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Bonif. 98:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Bonif. 98, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(matrimonii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 5, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42173.11" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The office of the ministry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athanasium episcopum... coctus in unum quaesitus (synodus ut appellant) removit a sacramento quod obtinebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrani: <entryFree id="n42174" type="main" key="Sa^cra_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săcrāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=321" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 321</bibl> (a), 18 Müll.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Săcrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Sacrani: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 796</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SACERDOTES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> p. 20, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrarium: <entryFree id="n42175" type="main" key="sa^_cra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sacer</etym>. <sense id="n42175.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place for the keeping of holy things</hi> (sometimes, also, a place for prayer); <hi rend="ital">a shrine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacristy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctuary</hi> (cf.: fanum, sacellum, delubrum); <cb n="SACR" /> <hi rend="ital">an oratory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chapel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notandum est aliud esse sacrum locum, aliud sacrarium. Sacer locus est locus consecratus, sacrarium est locus, in quo sacra reponuntur: quod etiam in aedificio privato esse potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 199</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. s. v. secespitam, p. 348 Müll.: erat apud Hejum sacrarium magnā cum dignitate in aedibus, a majoribus traditum, perantiquum: in quo signa pulcherrima quattuor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caere, sacrarium populi Romani, deversorium sacerdotum ac receptaculum Romanorum sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui habitat in tuo sacrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc sacrarium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tensam Jovis e sacrario in domum deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetito temerat sacraria probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ipsum sacrarium Bonae Deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:73:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 73, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mentis bonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 24, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">VENERIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CERERIS ANTIATINAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">MITHRAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1051 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis juvenibus bacchantibus ex obsceno sacrario eductis arma committenda?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42175.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a secret place</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (sc. te, Catilina) aquilam illam argenteam... cui domi tuae sacrarium scelerum tuorum constitutum fuit, sciam esse praemissam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa arcana (naturae) ... in interiore sacrario clausa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:31:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">in sanctiore secessu): testor mentis sacraria, Jovis jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:246" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrarius: <entryFree id="n42176" type="gloss" key="sa^_cra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sacer</etym>, <sense id="n42176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacristan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">IVNONIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1304</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrate: <entryFree id="n42177" type="main" key="sa^_cra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sacro, <sense id="n42177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacratio: <entryFree id="n42178" type="main" key="sa^_cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sacro</etym>, <sense id="n42178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consecration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedication</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrator: <entryFree id="n42179" type="main" key="sa^_cra_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hallows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consecrates</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 140" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42180" type="main" key="Sa^_cra_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Să_crātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 747</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacratus: <entryFree id="n42181" type="main" key="sa^_cra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from sacro.</entryFree>
sacravienses: <entryFree id="n42182" type="main" key="Sacravi^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sacravĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. via, I. A. 2 <sense id="n42182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacres: <entryFree id="n42183" type="main" key="sacres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">porci</orth>), v. sacer <sense id="n42183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacricola: <entryFree id="n42184" type="main" key="sa^_cri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>sacer-colo</etym>, <sense id="n42184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who conducted the</hi> sacra, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificing priest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">priestess</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl> (for which, sacrificuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, p. 361, 36</bibl>; Macr S. 5, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14, 3</bibl>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">reges sacricolae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sacrificing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. 47.</sense></entryFree>
sacrifer: <entryFree id="n42185" type="hapax" key="sa^_cri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacer-fero</etym>, <sense id="n42185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing sacred things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates (Aeneae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:252" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificalis: <entryFree id="n42186" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacrificium</etym>, <sense id="n42186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sucrifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificial</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 217, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministeria et instrumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificatio: <entryFree id="n42187" type="hapax" key="sa^_cri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sacrifico</etym>, <sense id="n42187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis (with precatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificator: <entryFree id="n42188" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen><etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificer</hi> (post class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sacrificatus: <entryFree id="n42189" type="hapax" key="sa^_cri^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum uspiam pecus sacrificatui, habemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificiolus: <entryFree id="n42190" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^ci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sacrificus</etym>, <sense id="n42190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who sacrifices</hi>: rex, <hi rend="ital">the priest who makes the offerings formerly made by the king</hi> (v. rex, I.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:4:31" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 4, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificium: <entryFree id="n42191" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrifice</hi> (class. and very freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n42191.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Popillius cum sacrificium publicum cum laenă faceret, quod erat flamen Carmentalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulare sacrificium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio Apollini facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium lustrale parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificio rite perpetrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemne et statutum sacrificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem ingenui decem virgines... ad id sacrificium adhibiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrifici genus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42191.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Druides sacrificia publica ac privata procurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificiis studere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificiis sollemnibus factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anniversaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice ejusdem generis habent sacrificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 1</bibl></cit>: aliquem sacrificiis<cb n="SACR" />  interdicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia facere Libero Liberaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: rex sacrificiorum, v. rex, A. 1.</sense></entryFree>
sacrifico: <entryFree id="n42192" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭco</orth> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_-crŭfĭco</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n42192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, ante-class., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 18</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:11:5" default="NO">2, 11, 5</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 2 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 105</bibl> ib.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat., sacrificati,</quote> <trans><tr>Christians who sacrifice to the gods under persecution</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 52</bibl></cit>) [sacer-facio], <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offer a sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sacrifice</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42192.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sacruficabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 44</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 109</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ter.Phorm. 4, 4, 21: principem in sacrificando Janum esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl> (repeatedly); 44, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:84 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 84 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu sacruficatum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sacruficem summo Jovi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculi sacrificare velle se dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo Jovi argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orco hostiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junoni reginae majoribus hostiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 38, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1, 13</bibl>; 36, 21, 9; and so without a <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 47, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 20, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 54, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 33, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum segetes huic deo sacrificatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pure et caste a matronis sacrificatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Angeronae) sacrificatur a. d. XII. Kal. Januar.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 6, 8, § 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42192.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullum turis granum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavam suem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:414" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc poculum deis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=122" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 122</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra Apollini pro me exercitibusque et classibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die Junoni mulieres sacrificantur, Varr.L.L. 6, 18: nec duobus nisi certis diis una sacrificari oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">editi dii quibus sacrificaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 37, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pelliculis sacrificatorum animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 39, § 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrificulus: <entryFree id="n42193" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sacrifico</etym>, <sense id="n42193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who conducts the sacrifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificing priest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificuli ac vates ceperant hominum mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl> (for which, sacricolae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 74</bibl>).—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans><tr>a high-priest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. rex, I.: vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sacrificus: <entryFree id="n42194" type="main" key="sa^_cri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sacrificing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrificial</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not ante-Aug.): securis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:590" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:483" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:243" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:27" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans><tr>of those sacrificing</tr>, <tr>praying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:130" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 130</bibl></cit>: Ancus, <hi rend="ital">mindful of sacrifices</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of religion</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:803" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 803</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Numa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <trans><tr>where human sacrifices were offered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:110" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 38</bibl></cit>: rex, v. rex, I.</sense></entryFree>
sacrilege: <entryFree id="n42195" type="main" key="sa^_cri^le^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕgē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sacrilegus <sense id="n42195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacrilegium: <entryFree id="n42196" type="main" key="sa^_cri^le^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sacrilegus</etym> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n42196.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The robbing of a temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stealing of sacred things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrilege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegium est, rem sacram de templo surripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:39" default="NO">5, 10, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1</bibl>; 42, 3 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:21" default="NO">7, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 3 al.</bibl> —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (with rapinae). —</sense><sense id="n42196.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Violation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profanation of sacred things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrilege</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum in caelum insanitis, non dico sacrilegium facitis, sed operam perditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine quodam sacrilegi metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sacrilegii damnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum se grate gerere sacrilegium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrilegus: <entryFree id="n42197" type="main" key="sa^_cri^le^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacer-lego</etym>, <sense id="n42197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that steals sacred things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that robs a temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrilegious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegas admovere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altare sacrilegum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,006:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jos. 22, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum templis et religionibus iste bellum sacrilegum habuit indictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (so usually): <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who robs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steals from a temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who commits sacrilege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilego poena est, neque ei soli, qui sacrum abstulerit, sed etiam ei, qui sacro commendatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sacrilegum, sed hostem sacrorum religionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: an sacrilegus, qui, ut hostes urbe expelleret, arma <pb n="1613" /> <cb n="SACR" /> templo affixa detraxit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 36</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:41" default="NO">3, 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:68" default="NO">4, 2, 68</bibl> (v. sacrilegium <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum ne fortiori subjungatur aliquid infirmius, ut sacrilego fur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">punit furta sacrilegus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:28:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 28, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42197.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">that violates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profanes sacred things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrilegious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi> (freq. since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n42197.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem perditum Miserumque, et illum sacrilegum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 23</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">o genera sacrilega!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum civis Romanus nemo erat sed Graeci sacrilegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrilegos ignes admovere templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:700" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 700</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricum artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas (Catilinae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:70:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 70, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hami (on account of the preceding sacris piscibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:30:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 12</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exi e fano, sacrilegissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42197.3" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">an impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">profane person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricida, sacrilege, perjure, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 792</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 817</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a violator of marriage vows</tr>, <tr>an adulterer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 9, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 41</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crĭlĕgē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sacrilegiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrima: <entryFree id="n42198" type="gloss" key="sacri^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacrĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">new wine offered to Bacchus</hi>: sacrima appellabant mustum, quod Libero sacrificabant pro vineis et vasis et ipso vino conservandis, sicut praemetium de spicis, quas primum messuissent, sacrificabant Cereri, Fest. pp. 318 and 319 Müll.; cf.: sacrima, <foreign lang="greek">a)parxh\ gleu/kous,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
sacriportus: <entryFree id="n42199" type="main" key="Sa^_cri^portus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Să_crĭ-portus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sacer</etym>. <sense id="n42199.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Prœneste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Sylla conquered the younger Marius</hi> (called in Appian, B. C. 1, 78, <foreign lang="greek">*(i(ero\s limh/n</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 68" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 68</bibl> and 75; <cit><quote lang="la">per tmesin: quot apud Sacri cecidere cadavera portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42199.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town on the Gulf of Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl>.—（</sense><sense id="n42199.2" n="III" level="1"> Dub., and resting only on the authority of Sext. Ruf. Region.: Urbis Romanae, <hi rend="ital">a square in Rome in the fourth region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Să_crĭpor-ticus</orth>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrium: <entryFree id="n42200" type="foreign" key="sacri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Scyth.</etym>, <sense id="n42200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Scythian amber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacro: <entryFree id="n42201" type="main" key="sa^_cro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_cro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sacer</etym>, <sense id="n42201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to declare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set apart as sacred; to consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">devote</hi> to a divinity (class.; cf. consecro). </sense><sense id="n42201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis agrum consecrato. Auri, argenti, eboris sacrandi modus esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum praedam Veientanam publicando sacrandoque ad nihilum redegisse, ferociter increpant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agrum) Cypriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolino Jovi donum ex auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(laurum) Phoebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilem ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum immortale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter haec auream aquilam pinnis extendenti similem sacraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum, in quo Helena sacravit calicem ex electro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 23, § 81</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus aris ibi Jovi et Soli sacratis cum immolasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacratas fide manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrata Crotonis Ossa tegebat humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rite pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 165</bibl></cit> al. —</sense><sense id="n42201.2" n="2" level="3"> With a bad accessory signif. (cf. sacer, II.), <hi rend="ital">to devote</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doom to destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to condemn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sacrando cum bonis capite ejus, qui regni occupandi consilia inisset, gratae in vulgus leges fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42201.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to set apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi> a thing to any one (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod patriae vocis studiis nobisque sacrasti, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 13, 22: hunc illi honorem Juppiter sacravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi sacratum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:552" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 552</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">injecere manum Parcae, telisque sacrarunt Evandri (Halaesum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 419</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42201.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42201.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To render sacred</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi> by consecration; <hi rend="ital">to hallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nemus aeterno cinerum sacravit honore Faenius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:117:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 117, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus, quod in Capitolio sacratum fuisset, irritum per illos esse,</quote> <trans><tr>that had been decreed inviolable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctiones sacrandae sunt genere ipso aut obtestatione legis, aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SACR" /> 33: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrata lex,</quote> <trans><tr>a law whose violation was punished by devoting the offender to the infernal gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 41</bibl>; 9, 39; 36, 38; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacratae leges sunt, quibus sanctum est, qui quid adversus eas fecerit, sacer alicui deorum sit cum familia pecuniaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=318" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 318</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42201.6" n="2" level="3"> Of a deity, <hi rend="ital">to hold sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to worship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">honor as sacred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud frustra te patrem deum hominumque hac sede sacravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesta sacrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 864</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42201.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to render imperishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to immortalize</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Lesbio plectro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">miratur nihil, nisi quod Libitina sacravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivit vigetque eloquentia ejus (Catonis), sacrata scriptis omnis generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avum Sacrārunt carmina tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hallowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrata jura parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura Graiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vittae Sacrati capitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (Tiberii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 640</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies sacratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen gentibus sacratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 24, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>devoted to the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 26.—At a later per., Sacratissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>an epithet of the emperors</tr>, <tr>Most Worshipful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Pan. ad Maxim. 1</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_-crātē</orth>, in eccl. Lat., </sense><sense id="n42201.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Holily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42201.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mysteriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mystically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrosanctus: <entryFree id="n42202" type="main" key="sa^_cro_sanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crōsanctus</orth> (sometimes separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">să_crō sanctus</orth>, <itype>and per tmesin, sacroque sanctum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 143</bibl>; but in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 13</bibl>, the correct read. is sacer sanctusque, not sacer sanctus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sacer-sancio</etym>, orig., <sense id="n42202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inaugurated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consecrated with religious ceremonies</hi> (v. the foll. passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl>); hence, </sense><sense id="n42202.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decreed as inviolable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inviolable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrosanct</hi>: ipsis quoque tribunis (<number>plur.</number>), ut sacrosancti viderentur (cujus rei prope jam memoria aboleverat), relatis quibusdam ex magno intervallo caerimoniis, renovarunt; et cum religione inviolatos eos, tum lege etiam fecerunt, sanciendo: ut qui tribunis plebis aedilibus, judicibus, decemviris nocuisset, ejus caput Jovi sacrum esset, etc. Hac lege juris interpretes negant quemquam sacrosanctum esse, sed cum quid eorum cuiquam nocuerit, id sacrum sanciri: itaque aedilem prehendi ducique a majoribus magistratibus: quod etsi non jure fiat (noceri enim ei, cui hac lege non liceat), tamen argumentum esse, non haberi pro sacro sanctoque aedilem; <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos vetere jure jurando plebis, cum primum eam potestatem creavit, sacrosanctos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrosanctum dicitur, quod jurejurando interposito est institutum, si quis id violasset, ut morte poenas penderet. Cujus generis sunt tribuni plebis aedilesque ejusdem ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=318" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 318</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrosanctum esse nihil potest, nisi quod populus plebesve sanxisset: deinde sanctiones sacrandae sunt genere ipso aut obtestatione legis aut poenā, cum caput ejus, qui contra fecerit, consecratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agi deinde de concordiā coeptum concessumque in condiciones, ut plebi sui magistratus essent sacrosancti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the tribunes of the people,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 9</bibl> (opp. profani); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 143</bibl>; cf.: sacrosancta potestas (tribunorum, <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator, velut sacrosanctus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: SI QVID SACROSANCTVM EST, an old formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vastatione omnium tuas possessiones sacrosanctas futuras putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonos etiam maritimos, qui sacrosanctam vacationem dicebantur habere, dare milites cogebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 38</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">Oedipodis ossa, honore arae decorata, quasi sacrosancta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n42202.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">most holy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most sacred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the Christian writers): cujus (Rufi) mihi memoria sacrosancta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">imago tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista civitas (Roma),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 270: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplatio conspectus tui (sc. episcopi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sacrosanctis ecclesiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrovir: <entryFree id="n42203" type="main" key="Sacro^vir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sacrŏvir</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> Julius Sacrovir, <sense id="n42203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nobleman of the Hœdui in Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sacrŏvĭrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <cb n="SAEC" /> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from Sacrovir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sacrufico: <entryFree id="n42204" type="main" key="sacru^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacrŭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. sacrifico <sense id="n42204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sacrum: <entryFree id="n42205" type="main" key="sacrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sacrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sacer.</entryFree>
sadala: <entryFree id="n42206" type="main" key="Sadala"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sadala</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42206.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Thrace</hi> (perh. <hi rend="ital">the father of Cotys</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl>; v. Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42206.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Cotys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
