sadducaei: <entryFree id="n42207" type="main" key="Saddu_caei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saddūcaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign />, <sense id="n42207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Sadducees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religious sect among the Jews</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saddūcaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Sadducees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saeclum: <entryFree id="n42208" type="main" key="saeclum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeclum</orth>, sync. for saeculum, q. v.</entryFree>
saecularis: <entryFree id="n42209" type="main" key="saecu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēcŭ-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saeculum</etym>, <sense id="n42209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> saeculum: ludi, secular games, celebrated at very long intervals (the interval was fixed, in the time of Augustus, at one hundred and twenty years), and continuing three days and nights, Varr. and Liv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11</bibl>: carmen, <hi rend="ital">a hymn sung at the secular games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a secular hymn;</hi> the best known hymn of this character is that composed by Horace, at the command of Augustus, to be sung at the secular games, A. U. C. 737; cf. Suet. Vit. Hor.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42209.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlāres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ludi), <hi rend="ital">the secular games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42209.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. sacra), <hi rend="ital">the secular games</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42209.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worldly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secular; pagan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heathen</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines (opp. monachi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> in Conc. post Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl></cit> (al. saeculi): <cit><quote lang="la">feminae quaedam (Dido, Lucretia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">worldly matters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redditur in culpā pastor saecularia servans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 94, 69</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a worldly manner</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem saeculariter ornari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Testim. 3, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saeculum: <entryFree id="n42210" type="main" key="saecu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saecŭlum</orth> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, esp. Lucretian, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sae-clum</orth>; less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēcŭlum, sē-clum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root si- = sa-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sa/w,</foreign> to sift; Lat. sero, satus; whence Saturnus, etc.; hence, orig.</etym>, <sense id="n42210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi> (freq. in Lucr.; very rare in later writers; usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">saecla propagare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:850" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 850</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec toties possent generatim saecla referre Naturam parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecla animantum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:855" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 855</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 467</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:339" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:722" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 722</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:995" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 995</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:753" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 753</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:413" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 413</bibl>; 4, 686; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestria ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:967" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 967</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentia ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 805</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:982" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 982</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1238" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1238</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucera (with lanigerae pecudes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 866</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1245" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1245</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetusta cornicum (with corvorum greges),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1084" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea pavonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totisque expectent saecula ripis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the shades of the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:592" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 592</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et muliebre oritur patrio de semine saeclum,</quote> <trans><tr>the female sex</tr>, <tr>women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1223</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">muliebre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1020" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1020</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n42210.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42210.2" n="A" level="2"> Like <foreign lang="greek">genea/.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n42210.3" n="1" level="3"> The ordinary lifetime of the human species, <hi rend="ital">a lifetime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">age</hi> (of thirty-three years; class.; esp. freq. in signif. 2. infra; cf. Schoem. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 21</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad idem, unde semel profecta sunt, cuncta astra redierint ... tum ille vere vertens annus appellari potest: in quo vix dicere audeo, quam multa saecula hominum teneantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex hac parte saecula plura numerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (Socratis atque Epicuri) aetates non annis sed saeculis scimus esse disjunctas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Cler. 4, p. 262</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 17</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 508</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42210.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the lifetime</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reign</hi> of a ruler: <cit><quote lang="la">illustrari saeculum suum ejusmodi exemplo arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna saeculo tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42210.5" n="2" level="3"> The human race living in a particular age, <hi rend="ital">a generation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the times</hi>: serit arbores quae alteri saeculo prosient, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in id saeculum Romuli cecidit aetas, cum jam plena Graecia poëtarum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum aetas cum in eorum tempora incidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 39</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">saeculorum reliquorum judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 19, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse fortasse in hujus saeculi errore versor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus saeculi insolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; and: o <pb n="1614" /> <cb n="SAEP" /> nostri infamia saecli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 97</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: novi ego hoc saeculum, moribus quibus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hujus saecli mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 13</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hoccine saeclum! o scelera! o genera sacrilega, o hominem impurum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mutam repertam esse dicunt mulierem ullo in saeculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato rudi saeculo litteras Graecas didicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grave ne rediret Saeculum Pyrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo statim beatissimi saeculi ortu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">beatissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix et aureum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 792</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his jungendi sunt Diocletianus aurei parens saeculi, et Maximianus, ut vulgo dicitur, ferrei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri, qui dii ex hominibus facti esse dicuntur, minus eruditis hominum saeculis fuerunt (with Romuli aetas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica constituta non unā hominum vitā sed aliquot saeculis et aetatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuā saeculorum admiratione celebrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda culpae saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro duravit saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ad ferrum venistis ab auro, Saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42210.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The spirit of the age</hi> or <hi rend="ital">times</hi>: nemo illic vitia ridet; <cit><quote lang="la">nec corrumpere et corrumpi saeculum vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42210.7" n="B" level="2"> The utmost lifetime of man, <hi rend="ital">a period of a hundred years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a century</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeclum spatium annorum centum vocārunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:2:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 2, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Fest. s. v. saeculares, p. 328 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Numa) illam sapientiam constituendae civitatis duobus prope saeculis ante cognovit, quam eam Graeci natam esse senserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculo festas referente luces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa virum durando saecula vincit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 295</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42210.8" n="2" level="3"> For an indefinitely long period, <hi rend="ital">an age; plur.</hi> (so mostly): <cit><quote lang="la">(Saturni stella) nihil immutat sempiternis saeculorum aetatibus, quin eadem iisdem temporibus efficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot saeculis post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquot saecula in Italiā viguisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tot,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:55:section=122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 55, § 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 26, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexcenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni saeculorum memoriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir saeculorum memoriā dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum monumenta, quae saeculis probarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facto in saecula ituro,</quote> <trans><tr>to future ages</tr>, <tr>to posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:312" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 312</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in famam et saecula mitti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 533</bibl></cit>: tarda gelu saeclisque effeta senectus, <hi rend="ital">with</hi> (many) <hi rend="ital">years</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 508</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum saeculi res in unum diem cumulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo putidam (anum) saeculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut videri possit saeculo prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 113</bibl></cit>.—Esp. (eccl. Lat.), the following phrases are used to express <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to all eternity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 3, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saeculum saeculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:36:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 36, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saecula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ps. 77, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in saecula saeculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; Ambros. Hexaëm. 3, 17, 72; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 16, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 1, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42210.9" n="C" level="2"> Like the biblical <foreign />, <foreign lang="greek">ai)w/n,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worldliness</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">immaculatus ab hoc saeculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: et servientem corpori Absolve vinclis saeculi, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 2, 583; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 5, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 23, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42210.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Heathenism</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">saeculi exempla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 13</bibl></cit> (al. saecularia).</sense></entryFree>
saepe: <entryFree id="n42211" type="main" key="saepe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <hi rend="ital">acc. n.</hi> of saepis</etym>. <sense id="n42211.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oftentimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">many times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi> (at indefinite intervals, while crebro denotes in close succession): <cit><quote lang="la">aperitur ostium, unde saturitate saepe ego exii ebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis damno et mihi lucro saepe eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi saepe hoc vulgo dicier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ex te audivi pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:30:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 30, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe hoc de majoribus natu audivimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum saepe mecum ageres, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ... saepe enim redeo ad Scipionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SAEP" /> 62; cf. <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca ... dicendum est enim saepius, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet lascivire, dum nihil metuas, ut in navi ac saepe etiam in morbo levi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc statu rei publicae, quem dixi jam saepe non posse esse diuturnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime saepe,</quote> <trans><tr>least frequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solet jocari saepe mecum illo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 18</bibl>; so (with solere) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 9</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo (Homero) saepissime vigilans (Ennius) solebat cogitare et loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ego multa saepe picta, quae Acherunti fierent cruciamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so (with multus) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 30, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 219</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe et multum hoc mecum cogitavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac (causā) multum et saepe versatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum saepe et diu ad pedes jacuit stratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus (piscis) minus saepe ad terram venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: illos (inimicos) saepe verum dicere, hos (amicos) numquam, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vos nimium saepe dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: bene saepe, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 241 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe antea (ante),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:112:2" default="NO" valid="yes">112, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42211.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi eos conspicias quam praetorem saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego saepius quam vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>.— More usu. without <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod, etsi saepe dictum est, dicendum est tamen saepius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6</bibl>, A: <cit><quote lang="la">semel atque iterum ac saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 12, 26</bibl></cit> (16): <cit><quote lang="la">semel et saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis ac saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum et saepius te rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum ac saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quidem schemate utuntur poëtae saepius, sed ne oratores quidem raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis novi, tanto saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propterea saepius te, ut memineris, moneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verbis, quid sit ... definiam saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ipsos induxi loquentes, ne inquam et inquit saepius interponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae potestas si mihi saepius sine meo vestroque periculo fiet, utar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si saepius decertandum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42211.2" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi saepissime Cyathisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optare ut quam saepissime peccet amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vinum aegrotis, qui prodest raro, nocet saepissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo (avo tuo) audisti multa ex me, eaque saepissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42211.3" n="II" level="1"> In general propositions stating the results of experience, to denote that which is wont to take place <hi rend="ital">frequently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud saepe fit, tempestas venit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam saepe est, quibus in rebus alius ne iratus quidem est, Cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ex hujusmodi re quāpiam ... magna familiaritas Conflatast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non licet hominem esse saepe ita ut volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo defuit fortasse ratio, sed tamen vincit ipsa rerum publicarum natura saepe rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 33, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">repeated: saepe ... saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe, five times in succession,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 33 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ... persaepe ... saepe ... saepe ... saepe ... modo ... modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... saepe ... modo ... interdum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ... modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum consilium subripitur saepissime, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42211.4" n="III" level="1"> Sometimes with numero, and also joined in one word with it, saepenumero, to strengthen the main idea, like our <hi rend="ital">oftentimes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">again and again</hi> (perh. not before the class. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aeduos fratres consanguineosque saepenumero a senatu appellatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; 6, 8; 7, 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 35, 4 al.—Once also in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gigni hominem saepe nono, saepiusnumero decimo mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saepenumero: <entryFree id="n42212" type="main" key="saepe^nu^me^ro_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepĕnŭmĕrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. saepe, III.</entryFree>
saepes: <entryFree id="n42213" type="main" key="saepes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>is</itype> (<case>nom.</case> saeps, Cic. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. in Grammaticom. 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:537" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 537</bibl>; <sense id="n42213.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but, saepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:374" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 374</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34, 6</bibl>; <cb n="SAEP" /> Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 56), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root svak-, to make firm; Sanscr. sag, to cling; cf. <foreign lang="greek">sa/ttw;</foreign> p for k, as in lupus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n42213.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a hedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fence; sing.</hi>, besides the passages above cited, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viva saepis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepes ex agresti ligno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 371</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 493</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42213.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of any <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">scopulorum, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saepicula: <entryFree id="n42214" type="main" key="saepi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepĭcŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>saepes</etym>, <sense id="n42214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hedge</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saepicule: <entryFree id="n42215" type="main" key="saepi^cu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepĭcŭle</orth>, <sense id="n42215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [saepe], <hi rend="ital">pretty often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretty frequently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever and anon</hi> (Appul.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 185, 6; 9, p. 231, 63; 9, p. 235, 33 al.</sense></entryFree>
saepimen: <entryFree id="n42216" type="main" key="saepi_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepīmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>saepio</etym>, = saepimentum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
saepimentum: <entryFree id="n42217" type="main" key="saepi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saepinum: <entryFree id="n42218" type="main" key="Saepi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saepīnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sēp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 45</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sae-pīnātes</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sœpinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saepio: <entryFree id="n42219" type="main" key="saepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, īre</itype> (<sense id="n42219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf. subj.</hi> saepissent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 3</bibl> dub.; v. Drak. ad loc.), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>saepes</etym>. </sense><sense id="n42219.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to surround with a hedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hedge in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fence in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi> (class.; cf. vallo). </sense><sense id="n42219.2" n="A" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case>: VTI LOCVS ANTE EAM ARAM ... STIPITIBVS ROBVSTIS SAEPIATVR, Cenot. Pisan. ap. Inscr Orell. 642; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saeptum undique et vestitum vepribus et dumetis indagavi sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.3" n="B" level="2"> In simple constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ne per fundum saeptum facias semitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.4" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. of time</hi>: pontifices negant segetem feriis saepiri debere, Col 2, 21, 2.—</sense><sense id="n42219.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42219.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n42219.7" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum operibus, unitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 39, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra tectis parietum pro muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos membranis tenuissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltum plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feram venantum coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituat legiones in locum, quo saeptae fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippam custodiā militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepsit se tectis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shut himself up in his palace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 600</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepsit comitium et curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fori aditūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albana pubes inermis ab armatis saepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap up;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: saeptus squalidā stolā (with vestitus), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 27 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sic avido complexu cetera saepsit (sc. aether),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Venus obscuro gradientes aëre saepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 411</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42219.11" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42219.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hedge up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, etc.: perii, lacrimae linguam saepiunt, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 41, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42219.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, etc.: (inventa) vestire atque ornare oratione: post memoriā saepire, <hi rend="ital">to enclose them in one's memory</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to get them by heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl>; cf.: is se circumvestit dictis, saepit sedulo, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 158</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">domi teneamus eam (orbam eloquentiam) saeptam liberali custodiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>; v. Jahn ad h. l.: locum omnem cogitatione (the figure taken from surrounding with toils in hunting; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">II. A.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeptus legibus et judiciorum metu,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounded</tr>, <tr>sheltered</tr>, <tr>guarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus praesidiis philosophiae saeptus sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saeptus praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: postquam omnia pudore saepta animadverterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with this cf.: (mulieres) saeptae pudicitiā agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lex) se saepit difficultate abrogationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quibusdam excubiis in ore positis saepiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saepis: <entryFree id="n42220" type="gloss" key="saepis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">suxno/s</foreign> [akin with saepes, q. v.], <sense id="n42220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that happens often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent.</hi> —As an <pos>adj.</pos> cited only once in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> saepior, by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1016</bibl> P.; and once in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: saepissimam discordiam fuisse, Cato Nep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 602</bibl> P. <pb n="1615" /> <cb n="SAET" /></sense></entryFree>
saepiuscule: <entryFree id="n42221" type="hapax" key="saepi^uscu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saepĭuscŭle</orth>, <sense id="n42221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [saepius, from saepe], <hi rend="ital">pretty often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretty frequently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 59</bibl></cit>; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 611</bibl> (al. saepicule).</sense></entryFree>
saeptatus: <entryFree id="n42222" type="main" key="saepta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeptātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>saeptum</etym>, <sense id="n42222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surrounded by a bulwark</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 208</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saeptio: <entryFree id="n42223" type="main" key="saepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saepio</etym>. <sense id="n42223.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a hedging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fencing in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosing</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl> (8), 5.—</sense><sense id="n42223.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosing with a wall</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">obj. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the erection of a wall around it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saeptum: <entryFree id="n42224" type="main" key="saeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeptum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (class.; usu. <number>plur.</number>). <sense id="n42224.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n42224.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a fence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">en closure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wall</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc de saeptis, quae tutandi causā fundi, aut partis fiant, dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: quibus enim saeptis tam immanes beluas continebimus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxea saepta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta candentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi saeptis revolsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transit fulmen caeli per saepta domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 490</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:860" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 860</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDICVLAM, ARAM, SAEPTVM, CLVSVM, VETVSTATE DIRVTA RESTITVIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1515</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: Saeptum lini, <hi rend="ital">a hunter's net</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toils</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 308</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42224.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any enclosed place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an enclosure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut intra saepta (sc. villae) habeat aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n42224.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A fold</hi> for cattle: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis multa meis exiret victima saeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta repetit pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:23:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A fish-pond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertimus intra saepta pelagios greges inertis mugilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a large enclosed place in the Campus Martius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the people assembled to vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and where were many handsome shops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille in saepta irruisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est (sc. dies) quoque, quo populum jus est includere saeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42224.9" n="d" level="4"> Saeptum venationis, <hi rend="ital">a park</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosed hunting-ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 2</bibl>; cf. the context.—</sense><sense id="n42224.10" n="B" level="2"> Any thing used for enclosing, etc.; hence, </sense><sense id="n42224.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A palisade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermem tribunum adoriantur fragmentis saeptorum et fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:37:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 37, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sluice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood-gate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:21:1:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 21, 1, § 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42224.13" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the diaphragm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">midriff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur ... ab ipso saepto orsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also transversum saeptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saeptuosus: <entryFree id="n42225" type="main" key="saeptu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeptŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saeptum</etym>, <sense id="n42225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: dictio, Pac. or Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 5 Rib.).— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saeptŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">obscurely</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saeta: <entryFree id="n42226" type="main" key="saeta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saeta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>. <sense id="n42226.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stiff hair</hi> on an animal; <hi rend="ital">a bristle</hi> (class.; usu. in <number>plur.</number>; cf. villus, pilus). </sense><sense id="n42226.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42226.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 786</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a boar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 428</bibl></cit>; cf. 2, B. infra; <cit><quote lang="la">of a porcupine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Hystr. 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the fish aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a goat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 312</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a cow,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 790</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a horse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita quasi saetis labra mihi compungit barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42226.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saetae leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:9:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 9, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42226.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeta equina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrae saetae grex (suum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 667</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42226.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42226.6" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, human <hi rend="ital">hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 312</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 850</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:56" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42226.7" n="B" level="2"> Of the <hi rend="ital">spiny leaves</hi> of coniferous trees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42226.8" n="C" level="2"> Of any thing made of coarse hair or bristles, e. g. <hi rend="ital">the bottom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leader</hi> of an angling-line, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscem tremulā salientem ducere saetā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 30, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42226.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A brush made from bristles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parieti siccato cera Punica cum oleo liquefacta candens saetis inducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saetabis: <entryFree id="n42227" type="main" key="Saeta^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saetăbis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sēt-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its flax</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Jativa</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:374" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 374</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42227.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saetăbĭtāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sēt-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sœtabis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42227.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saetăbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sēt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sœtabis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saetiger: <entryFree id="n42228" type="main" key="saeti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saetĭ-ger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēt-</orth>), <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seta-gero</etym>, <sense id="n42228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bristle-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having coarse hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bristles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setaceous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:969" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 969</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:974" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 974</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 549</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>of goats' hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49, 12</bibl></cit>.—As <cb n="SAEV" /> <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saetĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ferus), <hi rend="ital">the bristle-bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristler</hi>, as a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of the boar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 376</bibl>; Mart 13, 93, 1.</sense></entryFree>
saetosus: <entryFree id="n42229" type="main" key="saeto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saetōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saeta</etym>, <sense id="n42229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of coarse hairs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bristles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setous</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">villosus, pilosus): aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">setosa membra (of the sailors of Ulysses, transformed into swine by Circe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera,</quote> <trans><tr>made of goats' hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saetula: <entryFree id="n42230" type="main" key="saetu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saetŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little coarse hair of an animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small bristle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saeve: <entryFree id="n42231" type="main" key="saeve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. saevus <sense id="n42231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
saevidicus: <entryFree id="n42232" type="hapax" key="saevi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saevus-dico</etym>, <sense id="n42232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spoken furiously</hi> or <hi rend="ital">angrily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saevio: <entryFree id="n42233" type="main" key="saevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saevĭo</orth>, <itype>ii, ītum, 4</itype> (old form of the <sense id="n42233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> saevibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1003" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1003</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> saevibo, Mar. Vict. from <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 20, p. 443</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>saevus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be fierce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vent one's rage</hi> (very freq. since the Aug. per.; once in Cæs.; not in Cic.; but saevus and saevitia several times in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n42233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi equus saevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1075" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1075</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lupus) rabieque fameque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panthera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:613 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 613 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper in pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipiter in omnes aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:345" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes in alios saevientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42233.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of the cries of enraged animals: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc exaudiri gemitus iraeque leonum, ... atque in praesepibus ursi Saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 17</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc. (cf. Rib. ad loc., who conjectures mugire): <cit><quote lang="la">agni balant, porcelli gruniunt, ursi saeviunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42233.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any strong, passionate excitement, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave; to be furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">angry</hi>, etc. (cf.: furo, bacchor). </sense><sense id="n42233.4" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">here mi, nimium saevis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ah, ne saevi tantopere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne saevi, magna sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 544</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid saeviunt senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter qui saeviunt sapiunt magis,</quote> <trans><tr>who control their anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire Fortuna ac miscere omnia coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeviens turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionibus saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in delectibus saevire solitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">(paedagogi) imperiosi atque interim saevientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire securibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit animis ignobile vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis acerbis (with procedere longius iras),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater ardens Saevit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeviat atque novos moveat Fortuna tumultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire in tergum et in cervices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in obsides innoxios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conjuges ac liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:712 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 712 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellis in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 180</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in se (corresp. to manus sibi inferre),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 22</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mihi nunc saevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 88</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. saevus, II. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum manus impia saevit Sanguine Caesareo Romanum exstinguere nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 200</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clade saevitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat Trojā captā in ceteros saevitum esse Trojanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquid (aliquem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74:44" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 62 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42233.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit minaci murmure ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 276</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra mare saepe coortum Saevibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1003" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1003</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum longus inter saeviat Ilion Romamque pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 3</bibl></cit>: ventus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Aufidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius dies solstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 766" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum in praecordiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venter (sc. fame),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor stridoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:600" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi flagrans amor ... Saeviet circa jecur ulcerosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevit amor ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 532</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor in erepto amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 36</bibl></cit> (8 b, 20): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor in praecordiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fortuna magis saevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:499" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: acerbus odor. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:493" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 493</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer hinnitus equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:97" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 97</bibl></cit>: oratio ferociens <cb n="SAEV" /> saeviensque (opp. demissa jacensque), Gell 1, 11, 15.</sense></entryFree>
